commit_message:
Remove the objectify decorator

The objectify decorator was used to convert DB objects into RPC objects,
but it's not being used anymore since out objects API already has
correspondent methods to match the dbapi ones.

Also, since dbapi methods didn't get a context the decorator was forming
bad RPC objects without a context stored within it.

Change-Id: I892ab6ee2236af040c7f8effcfdfecb293e13ab6
Partial-Bug: #1314732

commit_message:
Use 'configure' instead of 'enable' when talking about kernel function configuration

Because we enable and disable kernel networking functions we should
use 'configure' instead of 'enable'.

Change-Id: Ia0aa260bfa49c076ab62fd3a161b986140c7912d

commit_message:
Call unbind_snat_servicenode from schedule router

Refactor to move the call to plugin.unbind_snat_servicenode from
schedule_snat_router to _schedule_router.  This is a move to pave the
way for removing hints from schedule router.

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2014-09-01 04:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/vs_port/ovs_redhat.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/vs_port/ovs_redhat_el6.rb', 'lib/puppetx/redhat/ifcfg.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/vs_bridge/ovs_redhat.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/vs_port.rb'], 'message': 'Refacfored a more suitable ovs_redhat provider

  - Added a helper class/library to handle ifcfg content

  - Removed keep_ip and sleep parameters, replaced by
    automatic behaviour

  - No need for a redhat vs_bridge provider

  - Only port/bridge associated with a phyical interface get a
    ifcfg file managed

  - Requires Puppet 2.7.8+
    Not using optional_commands anymore

When the bridge is associated with an active physical interface
  - It will be initially populated from the existing interface
    file, inheriting its parameters

Change-Id: I584fb1442de9a760b3a092f96cbfcbcd6776fdba
'}]
commit_message:
Refacfored a more suitable ovs_redhat provider

  - Added a helper class/library to handle ifcfg content

  - Removed keep_ip and sleep parameters, replaced by
    automatic behaviour

  - No need for a redhat vs_bridge provider

  - Only port/bridge associated with a phyical interface get a
    ifcfg file managed

  - Requires Puppet 2.7.8+
    Not using optional_commands anymore

When the bridge is associated with an active physical interface
  - It will be initially populated from the existing interface
    file, inheriting its parameters

Change-Id: I584fb1442de9a760b3a092f96cbfcbcd6776fdba

commit_message:
Catch NotImplementedError on reset_network for xen

This patch adds a @messaging.expected_exceptions(NotImplementedError)
decorator around reset_network as xen raises NotImplementedError here.

Change-Id: Ib1a0cb400ea89f387cd43630d8c647bf5c99f7ab
Closes-bug: #1306404

commit_message:
Replace fakes.FakeClient inheritence with Mock

NovaFakeClient had fakes.FakeClient as a super classes.

This dependency broke the build as the interface was not
well defined

Replace the super classe FakeClient with MagicMock and implement
the local return types as mock object

Closes-bug: 1364515
Change-Id: I746daf38f985eba824a5a0759f450766b08b2dab

commit_message:
Shortened tablenames constants in Neutron driver

Previously, the constants for tablenames in the Neutron
driver were all prefixed with NEUTRON_, e.g.
NEUTRON_PORTS_SECURITY_GROUPS.  This prefix is unnecessary
since it is clear from context.

This change removes the prefix throughout the codebase.

Change-Id: Ib9cea8243886523ad639f7151ac593fc3ad21804

subject: Fixed Neutron translation of external_gateway_info
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-04 23:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/tests/unit/test_neutron_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/neutron_driver.py'], 'message': "Fixed Neutron translation of external_gateway_info

Previously, the translation of the router's external_gateway_info
basically either returned True or False, indicating whether or
not the external_gateway_info was None or not.

This change properly translates external_gateway_info
into either None or a hash table.  It also adds tests
for router and security_group translations.

Change-Id: Ie482d57d6e644bffc9cf0f57a578f04a6e5fabbe

commit_message:
Fixed Neutron translation of external_gateway_info

Previously, the translation of the router's external_gateway_info
basically either returned True or False, indicating whether or
not the external_gateway_info was None or not.

This change properly translates external_gateway_info
into either None or a hash table.  It also adds tests
for router and security_group translations.

Change-Id: Ie482d57d6e644bffc9cf0f57a578f04a6e5fabbe

Change-Id: I21d6f5926560a2e720a4e8240381237bdacdfe70
"}]
commit_message:
Added schema interface to datasource drivers

Previously, the Nova and Neutron datasource drivers had
different ways of exporting their schemas.

This change introduces an interface for exposing a schema.
The interface consists of one method, 'get_schema', which
returns a dictionary that maps each tablename to a tuple
of column names.

Change-Id: I21d6f5926560a2e720a4e8240381237bdacdfe70

subject: Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-11 08:49:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/decom.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/flow.py', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/standby.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/base.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/flow.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/extensions/decom.py'], 'message': "Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is moved from decorated function to
decorator signature in both decorators. Every call of decorated functions
is fixed, BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra
argument. BaseAgentExtension.__init__ automatically generates command_map
from decorated methods.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: 1314148
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance decorators in agent and automate creation of command_map

sync_command and async_command in ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py
are implemented so that they change decorated method signature,
which is really bad practice. Example:

@sync_command
def orig_method(self, **kw):
...

sync_command decorator returns lambda which has one additional
argument 'command_name'

def sync_command(func):
    def decorated(self, command_name, **kw):
         ...
         func(self, **kw)
         ...
    return decorated

Additional parameter 'command_name' is moved from decorated function to
decorator signature in both decorators. Every call of decorated functions
is fixed, BaseAgentExtension.execute is updated to not send this extra
argument. BaseAgentExtension.__init__ automatically generates command_map
from decorated methods.

Change-Id: Iff0f495bc8d9c731892feb0f4759a7f10ee76328
Closes-Bug: 1314148

commit_message:
Configure enabled and disabled extensions in tempest

This patch adds support for configuring the api_extensions
option of the various feature-$service-(enabled|disabled)
sections in tempest's configuration file.

Please note that enabled extensions for the object storage
service are specified in tempest using the discoverable_apis
configuration options.

Partially-implements: Blueprint branchless-tempest-extensions

Change-Id: Ib64c0a474b153f42f3a4a427d86275c85f107997

subject: Add 'details' property to VMwareDriverException
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 12:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/vmware/api.py', 'oslo/vmware/exceptions.py', 'tests/test_api.py'], 'message': "Add 'details' property to VMwareDriverException

The details property of the VimFaultException is very important and we
loose this information when we convert VimFaultException to a specific
subclass of VMwareDriverException. This patch fix this by propagating
the details to VMwareDriverException.

Change-Id: I42a50b60fc74383a2c1d9b907125ff17795ce440
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'details' property to VMwareDriverException

The details property of the VimFaultException is very important and we
loose this information when we convert VimFaultException to a specific
subclass of VMwareDriverException. This patch fix this by propagating
the details to VMwareDriverException.

Change-Id: I42a50b60fc74383a2c1d9b907125ff17795ce440

Add two new functions to manipulate with lists

a part of original list.

commit_message:
Skipping dashboard test to unblock gate

The error is only seen in the gate when run in parallel, to ease
contention on the gate, temporarily disabling until a proper
solution has been determined.

Related-Bug: #1345955
Change-Id: I3b61895e3f2b0d96488bef56dc0c6105a212d4dc

subject: nova: support setting scheduler_host_manager
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-07 21:33:16.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova/os-apply-config/etc/nova/nova.conf', 'elements/nova/README.md'], 'message': 'nova: support setting scheduler_host_manager

Adds support for setting scheduler_host_manager if
it is set via heat metadata. Previously this
value was hard coded based upon the use of
either Ironic or Nova baremetal.

The motivation here is to be able to use the new Ironic driver
location in the Nova tree.

Change-Id: Id4ca7f90cd85129727e65d0d09f274f3a00d4ebe
'}]
commit_message:
nova: support setting scheduler_host_manager

Adds support for setting scheduler_host_manager if
it is set via heat metadata. Previously this
value was hard coded based upon the use of
either Ironic or Nova baremetal.

The motivation here is to be able to use the new Ironic driver
location in the Nova tree.

Change-Id: Id4ca7f90cd85129727e65d0d09f274f3a00d4ebe

MagnetoDB API doesn't require atomic batches
so we can improve performance by using unlogged batches

Implements: bp improve-batch-write-performance

Change-Id: I139358ad6424095243f36b7f2a619ed0243ecdfe
"}]
commit_message:
Use unlogged batches instead of atomic batches

MagnetoDB API doesn't require atomic batches
so we can improve performance by using unlogged batches

Implements: bp improve-batch-write-performance

Change-Id: I139358ad6424095243f36b7f2a619ed0243ecdfe

commit_message:
Add uefi boot mode support in IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy

The following functionality need to be added in iLO driver:
  - Add set_boot_mode function to iLO driver to switch between
    bios and uefi boot modes.
  - Validate boot_mode for IloVirtualMediaIscsiDeploy driver.

Change-Id: Ic8496a2d97aab6634b573c85d379b446c49e04b9
Implements: blueprint uefi-boot-for-ironic

subject: Don't write python bytecode while testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 12:33:34.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ib1e52753bc8c75741067c19ff234999f570762ed
Related-Bug: #1368661
"}]
commit_message:
Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ib1e52753bc8c75741067c19ff234999f570762ed
Related-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Don't write python bytecode while testing

This should reduce the number of times you need to do things like git
clean -x -i to kill pyc files in your local directory to get tests to
pass.
It doesn't appear to address pyc files in the .tox directories, and
attempts to address that seem to go in circles. Ideas welcomed.

Change-Id: Ic0f74c02b94f40723364055316e8dd2e7dffa8ad
Related-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Remove templates from toctrees

We don't want the templates to show up in the RSS feed, so exclude them
from being converted to HTML and listed in the toctree.

Change-Id: I67496730d1952ffdec92c5f78531508c55225ca6

commit_message:
Add RSS feed

Publish an RSS feed of the changes to the specs repository to make the
specs more discoverable.

Change-Id: Ib4f84efab8b3af3ddd47d38d63a91362612bd655

subject: Do not allow to create 5.0-based environments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 14:05:04.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/static/js/views/wizard.js'], 'message': "Do not allow to create 5.0-based environments

5.0 releases don't have version suffix, so filter them out by
comparing release version to '2014.1'

Change-Id: I7a1c1e6148e145ba6e89e8d451e21b5de67a4662
Closes-bug: 1368100

commit_message:
Do not allow to create 5.0-based environments

5.0 releases don't have version suffix, so filter them out by
comparing release version to '2014.1'

Change-Id: I7a1c1e6148e145ba6e89e8d451e21b5de67a4662
Closes-bug: 1368100

Change-Id: Ic503f07bc882f589619105df59a6a7cacf352207

commit_message:
Adding /etc/ dir to location of edp-examples to reflect reality

Adding /etc/ dir to location of edp-examples since that is the
actual location where they wound-up.

Closes-Bug: #1368382
Change-Id: Ic503f07bc882f589619105df59a6a7cacf352207

subject: Fixed regression in file writing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-12 13:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/writer/osrf.py', 'cloudkitty/write_orchestrator.py'], 'message': "Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it
in the OSRF writer.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed regression in file writing

Flags got moved from a to a+ but it's unsupported by ZipFile.
Changed the name of the write_backend variable but forgot to change it
in the OSRF writer.

Change-Id: I6ddf14c07e84af0a5e5b0994d72a8bfc506adce0

subject: Debug semaphore creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 17:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'message': "Debug semaphore creation

Just adds some debugging around when semaphores are created so we
can tell if they're being double-locked or just destroyed and
recreated.

Change-Id: Ia266fbdc87fcacdbc3eddcab83a3a39caff6c19c
"}]
commit_message:
Debug semaphore creation

Just adds some debugging around when semaphores are created so we
can tell if they're being double-locked or just destroyed and
recreated.

Change-Id: Ia266fbdc87fcacdbc3eddcab83a3a39caff6c19c

commit_message:
add oslo.utils for testing with Keystoneclient master

stable/* tests run with keystoneclient master and
master keystoneclient will be changing to require
oslo.utils.

Conflicts:

	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ia29f69731d4dc79e8fc5d14afa932558de387799
Closes-Bug: #1357652
(cherry picked from commit 087550b02b63fdd6ffd5114829591f9b859853ac)

commit_message:
Add code/api documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I4baea1efa227ef14bc6706d59ff3dcad93c2eacc
Closes-Bug: #1364140

subject: Add API to enable calling module to register an exception
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-10 08:50:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/vmware/exceptions.py', 'tests/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Add API to enable calling module to register an exception

In certain cases the application, for example Nova, may need to treat
a VC exception that is currently not supported by oslo.vmware.

This will enable the application to dynamically add exceptions and then
remove them when oslo.vmware is updated to support the new exception.

The patch also fixes a typo with the exception fault handling.

Change-Id: I332a4ff2ac2c6d4e6ac88bbd067ef0d4e659ffa3
'}]
commit_message:
Add API to enable calling module to register an exception

In certain cases the application, for example Nova, may need to treat
a VC exception that is currently not supported by oslo.vmware.

This will enable the application to dynamically add exceptions and then
remove them when oslo.vmware is updated to support the new exception.

The patch also fixes a typo with the exception fault handling.

Change-Id: I332a4ff2ac2c6d4e6ac88bbd067ef0d4e659ffa3

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-08 11:16:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
(cherry picked from commit 60cb0911712ad11688b4d09e5c01ac39c49f5aea)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I7f59e2c1e757c28dae35c44ebfad9d764ae1d3c5
Closes-Bug: 1240849
(cherry picked from commit 60cb0911712ad11688b4d09e5c01ac39c49f5aea)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-04 11:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/common/test_accounts.py', 'tempest/common/accounts.py'], 'message': 'Add a NotLockingAccounts credentials provider

This credentials provider does not do any locking, so it
does not suffer from the lack of credentials cleanup which
affects the regular locking Accounts class.

Using thie credentials provider allows to keep it possible
to run tempest with no tenant isolation, and in serial mode,
as it is done today by one of periodic jobs.

Partially-implements bp:test-accounts
Change-Id: I160d183a299d2e46d269428409af680c0fdb03b5
'}]
commit_message:
Add a NotLockingAccounts credentials provider

This credentials provider does not do any locking, so it
does not suffer from the lack of credentials cleanup which
affects the regular locking Accounts class.

Using thie credentials provider allows to keep it possible
to run tempest with no tenant isolation, and in serial mode,
as it is done today by one of periodic jobs.

Partially-implements bp:test-accounts
Change-Id: I160d183a299d2e46d269428409af680c0fdb03b5

Nova v2 hypervisor server API return attribute "uuid" in response's
server dict. Current response schema does not have this attribute instead
it contain "id" which is wrong.

commit_message:
Fix V2 hypervisor server schema attribute

Nova v2 hypervisor server API return attribute "uuid" in response's
server dict. Current response schema does not have this attribute instead
it contain "id" which is wrong.

This patch fix the above issue.

NOTE- "uuid" attribute in this API response is always a uuid.

Change-Id: I78c67834de930012b70874938f345524d69264ba

commit_message:
Fix sample-create in v2 api calls

A dict embedded in a list is the expected input. In
47934c777c50897b649793e0960eebdaad322c45 the list was lost, this
puts it back.

Note that the _exact_ date of this failure was identified by
existing Rally jobs which started failing in early August. That made
searching the commit logs straightforward.

Change-Id: I37e794de7a23b8ce8e67a086732af5a19f182409

commit_message:
Allow some translations to be made.

Transform some action_present and action_past variables from attributes to
methods with the solution proposed in this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/91338/
Also fix a bug in the solution above where the __init__ function in the
deleteAction class overwrite the action_present and action_past methods.
Closes-Bug: 1366731

Change-Id: I9595f9d5a5a3f1ef4d528ddb3e08737a43471402

commit_message:
Make strutils.mask_password more secure

Make some enhancements to strutils.mask_password to allow it to
catch more cases of passwords in strings.

The following is a listing of patterns that will be handled. The
keyword that mask_password uses (a list of four now) is represented
by <key> and the password is shown as <password>. Quotes (both single
and double) are represented as <quote>.

--<key> <password>
--<key> <quote><password><quote>
<key> = <password>
<key> = <quote><password><quote>

All existing tests and patterns are still handled.

Cherry-pick from 61d5de69850bf082b2aa45747104b2b5be764c21
Partial-Bug: #1345233

Conflicts:
	nova/openstack/common/strutils.py

Change-Id: I693baaf225c5b393401d499d14f271cadb63eb2c

commit_message:
Initial kerberos plugin implementation.

This patch will allow to use kerberos credentials to retrieve
a token during a post on /v3/auth/tokens. It will force the negotiate
communication with the client if the method specified is kerberos
and leaves unaffected the other plugins.

bp: kerberos-authentication

Change-Id: I2fad67c3613c273187f6ca32985d360352c81bf8

commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception.

Cherry-pick from 853d8f9897f8563851441108a9be26b10908c076
Partial-Bug: #1343604

Conflicts:
	nova/openstack/common/processutils.py

Change-Id: I9741dcdebdb4bed295ddc5ec4c4b117fffcfe88c

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2014-09-09 11:51:56.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/actions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

This patch also adds contextual mrkers to STATUS_DISPLAY_CHOICES,
TASK_DISPLAY_CHOICES and POWER_DISPLAY_CHOICES because it was impossible to
translate the stand-alone words out of context for a translator (i.e. the word
"active" will be translated differently if the active object is feminine or
masculine, since feminine and masculine depends also on the language, it is
mission impossible for the translator to translate "active" if he does not know
"what" is "active").

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the strings of the instance view actions.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

partial-bug: 1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716
'}]
commit_message:
Allow translators to translate BatchActions

Currently BatchAction proposes only an action_present and action_past verb
to be concatenated with a data_type_singular or data_type_plural string.

The issue is that many languages need to conjugate the verb with the
plural/singular subject, and some translations where terribly awfull and
impossible to do.
Indeed, some languages have up to 5 plural forms depending on the number of
items.

This patch introduces the fact that action_present is a method instead of an
attribute, which in conjonction with https://review.openstack.org/57701 allows
better translation to be performed.

This patch also adds contextual mrkers to STATUS_DISPLAY_CHOICES,
TASK_DISPLAY_CHOICES and POWER_DISPLAY_CHOICES because it was impossible to
translate the stand-alone words out of context for a translator (i.e. the word
"active" will be translated differently if the active object is feminine or
masculine, since feminine and masculine depends also on the language, it is
mission impossible for the translator to translate "active" if he does not know
"what" is "active").

It is important to use unicode strings with contextual markers because of the
following django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/22565
The django community was very quick and responsive and fixed the bug very fast:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/142c27218a0bb07bb197faab7b1d8eb3a084f5b9
and back-ported their fix in the 1.6 and 1.7 django branches:
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/61fd00d4fd65f44d0a05be4c7e95124e4102ec27
https://code.djangoproject.com/changeset/034866204b39f797c73997b03cd90443aa03aa91
but since in horizon we support back to django 1.4, we will have to live with
it by providing unicode strings until we drop support of old django versions.

We can't introduce contextual markers and ungettext (pluralization) verywhere
at once because Translators would totally loose their previous work. So we have
to progressively introduce contextual markers and pluralization, when a string
is changed, or for new strings. It is also the reason why this patch changes
only the strings of the instance view actions.

Since we can't use contextual markers and pluralization for all the code at
once, this patch partially:

partial-bug: 1307476

Change-Id: I4cef42dc4a12f55cf750d9a18083254c6a96e716

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-01 23:36:15.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/api/network/test_ports.py', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Fix IPv6 default masks for SLAAC

IETF doesn't recommend use of IPv6 networks
with masks not "/64". Recommended subnetting is
3-1-4 - 48 for provider, 16 for subnetting and

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 default masks for SLAAC

IETF doesn't recommend use of IPv6 networks
with masks not "/64". Recommended subnetting is
3-1-4 - 48 for provider, 16 for subnetting and
64 for network. For example SLAAC will not
work if you use subnets different from /64.
Test with port update will not work until
bug 1364166 is fixed, added attribute to it.

Change-Id: I260c820dbde1f98b569e564c7b5e7e558e431c0d

commit_message:
Allow to pass dict from resource discovery

Allowing to pass dict from resource discovery and storing it
as metadata. Before it was only possible to pass IP address,
which is not enough.
For TripleO case, important metadata like image name and flavor
from Nova are passed and stored in resource, allowing to make
aggregate queries according to them.

Change-Id: I4dabf79f248842398e1126d310d110b1fe95fad5
Closes-Bug: #1366871

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-09-12 05:42:08.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/cmd/register_nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/nodes.py', 'os_cloud_config/tests/test_nodes.py', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'os_cloud_config/cmd/tests/test_register_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Update node details during node registration

If register-nodes is run a second time with the same set of nodes,
it will blindly try and re-register them, leading to failures from
the Nova or Ironic API. Instead, we now look for identifying marks
of registered nodes, and then update those nodes.

At the end, we check to see if there are any extra nodes registered,
and warn, possibly cleaning them up.

Change-Id: I8652c25077246626810f186259adbf14764f4571
'}]
commit_message:
Update node details during node registration

If register-nodes is run a second time with the same set of nodes,
it will blindly try and re-register them, leading to failures from
the Nova or Ironic API. Instead, we now look for identifying marks
of registered nodes, and then update those nodes.

At the end, we check to see if there are any extra nodes registered,
and warn, possibly cleaning them up.

Change-Id: I8652c25077246626810f186259adbf14764f4571

commit_message:
Hiding "Launch as Instance" if volume is not bootable.

If a volume which is not bootable, is used to create an instance
then the instance will go into 'Error' state.
The patch solves this issue by hiding the 'Launch as Instance'
button if the volume is not bootable.

Closes-Bug: #1327310

Change-Id: I3d9e7edf846fafab4e735d562c1ec72ad32fb220

subject: Looks for variable subtitution in the same group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 14:58:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py', 'tests/test_cfg.py'], 'message': "Looks for variable subtitution in the same group

When we do a variable subtitution we must try to look if the option
is avialable into the same group and then into the default one for backward
compatibilty.

Otherwise variable subtitution doesn't works when we change the group of
an option and deprecated the DEFAULT group.

Change-Id: Ie5750ee028a58fba6da225a8c4b4221e23db829f
Closes-bug: #1367790
"}]
commit_message:
Looks for variable subtitution in the same group

When we do a variable subtitution we must try to look if the option
is avialable into the same group and then into the default one for backward
compatibilty.

Otherwise variable subtitution doesn't works when we change the group of
an option and deprecated the DEFAULT group.

Change-Id: Ie5750ee028a58fba6da225a8c4b4221e23db829f
Closes-bug: #1367790

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-29 03:08:17.000000000', 'files': ['marconiclient/queues/v1/cli.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "CLI support for queue existence and metadata operations

This patch extends the queues operation supported by the CLI.
It also renames some of the previously added features to make
them more consistent with their behaviour.

Features added:
- Check queue existence
- Set queue metadata
- Get queue metadata
- Get queue stats

Some examples:
	$ openstack queue exists myqueue
	$ openstack queue set metadata myqueue
	$ openstack queue stats myqueue

The above assumes Keystone is installed and has an endpoint
configured for Marconi. In order to bypass this in a non-Keystone
based deployment, the user can pass Marconi's url manually:

    $  openstack --os-token test
                 --os-url http://127.0.0.1:8888
		 queue exists myqueue

Change-Id: I2d8d793037470a629e52e329a17a6fed04314c3d
Partially-Implements: blueprint cli
"}]
commit_message:
CLI support for queue existence and metadata operations

This patch extends the queues operation supported by the CLI.
It also renames some of the previously added features to make
them more consistent with their behaviour.

Features added:
- Check queue existence
- Set queue metadata
- Get queue metadata
- Get queue stats

Some examples:
	$ openstack queue exists myqueue
	$ openstack queue set metadata myqueue
	$ openstack queue stats myqueue

The above assumes Keystone is installed and has an endpoint
configured for Marconi. In order to bypass this in a non-Keystone
based deployment, the user can pass Marconi's url manually:

    $  openstack --os-token test
                 --os-url http://127.0.0.1:8888
		 queue exists myqueue

Change-Id: I2d8d793037470a629e52e329a17a6fed04314c3d
Partially-Implements: blueprint cli

commit_message:
Move OpenStack update timeout to the settings.py

Make update timeout setting configurable via exporting
environment variable, so it could be tuned for different
deployment scenarios. Also increase timeout value to 1 hour
by default.

Change-Id: I110d9bf1b6c8dd68d38ffc76c0185c55eee87298

environment variable, so it could be tuned for different

commit_message:
Wait until Nailgun's API is ready after VM reset

After resetting Fuel master node we wait until 8000/tcp
port (nginx) is accepting connections. We also should wait
up to 2 minutes until Nailgun's API is ready.

Change-Id: I2360e0dab68ae0a20618f1da64ee5d6b4499e126
Closes-bug: #1368537

commit_message:
Wait until Nailgun's API is ready after VM reset

After resetting Fuel master node we wait until 8000/tcp
port (nginx) is accepting connections. We also should wait
up to 2 minutes until Nailgun's API is ready.

Change-Id: I2360e0dab68ae0a20618f1da64ee5d6b4499e126
Closes-bug: #1368537

commit_message:
Use immutable arg rather mutable arg

Passing mutable objects as default args is a known Python pitfall.
We'd better avoid this. This commit changes mutable default args with
None, then use 'arg = arg or []'.

Change-Id: Ie036e8203deb9ab10ffb7bce1db6cda6c3672a0c

commit_message:
Do not incur the cost of a second method call

The usage of dict.get here is unnecessary since dict.setdefault will
not override an existing value.

When keepalived starts with invalid config file (e.g. interface to bind to

Change-Id: I1518147ce9bacedad0b735be5ec2634f9c2670ac

commit_message:
Don't start keepalived service until required configuration is available

When keepalived starts with invalid config file (e.g. interface to bind to
is not set), then keepalived process generates thousands error messages into
log file and then fails anyway.

subject: Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 19:21:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': "Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner

Ironic doesn't require these to be shutdown but leaving them running
leads to nodes running in CI from previous tests hitting the API of
services in the current test. The resulting errors and trace-backs
are confusing when debugging problems.

Change-Id: Ia5bccd69af0f92c14db901f09b32521821ba567d
"}]
commit_message:
Destroy pre existing VM's regardless of Provisioner

Ironic doesn't require these to be shutdown but leaving them running
leads to nodes running in CI from previous tests hitting the API of
services in the current test. The resulting errors and trace-backs
are confusing when debugging problems.

Change-Id: Ia5bccd69af0f92c14db901f09b32521821ba567d

commit_message:
Make assertion in assert_ostf_run_certain more verbose

Right now if assert_ostf_run_certain fails, the output is
"AssertionError: Condition was False."
which does not help much. The change makes it more verbose
giving the details of tests which must have passed but failed.

Change-Id: Iab373c3d4809e6f27147f9331f80ba03f02ae801
(cherry picked from commit beac5f49350d99167a8c797e68d78bb63501a968)

commit_message:
Remove extraneous created_iso property

The Redis driver's MessageEnvelope model has a created_iso property
that was only used in one place. This patch removes the property
and simply calls timeutils directly in the one place it is needed.

Change-Id: Icb7aab9d5e0c1e33684951bb5dc4182825f16465

commit_message:
Pass instance to set_instance_error_state vs. uuid

Quick fix to patch one case in which instance.uuid was still being
passed to _set_instance_error_state when retries are disabled in
rescheduling cases.  Also updated the respective test case.

Change-Id: I24a682b926bc570d7e932ffedc664a95d41fda85
Closes-Bug: #1367342

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-29 11:58:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift-deploy.yaml', 'swift-source.yaml'], 'message': 'Parametrizing the number of Swift replicas

Currently the number of Swift replicas is set to 1.  However most
deployments will use a replica count of 3.  We have added a
parameter SwiftReplicas with a default of 1 to allow a user to set
the replica count when creating an overcloud stack.

Change-Id: Ic676e44392786745818396dcc98cd9883a1ddd6d
'}]
commit_message:
Parametrizing the number of Swift replicas

Currently the number of Swift replicas is set to 1.  However most
deployments will use a replica count of 3.  We have added a
parameter SwiftReplicas with a default of 1 to allow a user to set
the replica count when creating an overcloud stack.

Change-Id: Ic676e44392786745818396dcc98cd9883a1ddd6d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-12 10:20:17.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_managers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/fake.py'], 'message': 'Always revert to inital state in fake mode

* when nailgun runs in fake mode when node that belongs to cluster and
  is offline will not be completely remove when reset/delete action
* add new option `restore_offline_nodes` to `fake_tasks` decorator
  in tests to control this behavior
* fixed WebTest warning about body in DELETE request in tests from
  test_cluster_handler.py
* add test for new behavior

Change-Id: I9d400e1e8c385cd594c74d7f529e4e1fbe6d7843
Closes-Bug: #1335133
'}]
commit_message:
Always revert to inital state in fake mode

* when nailgun runs in fake mode when node that belongs to cluster and
  is offline will not be completely remove when reset/delete action
* add new option `restore_offline_nodes` to `fake_tasks` decorator
  in tests to control this behavior
* fixed WebTest warning about body in DELETE request in tests from
  test_cluster_handler.py
* add test for new behavior

Change-Id: I9d400e1e8c385cd594c74d7f529e4e1fbe6d7843
Closes-Bug: #1335133

commit_message:
Refactor ways of creating anonymous test user

Some Swift tests require random user creation to test ACL features or
prepare special data by reseller admin's requests, but that occurs
code duplication. Especially, assigning role id code was too lengthy.

This commit aggregates common codes and remove unused clean-up statements.

Change-Id: I4b965fceeec7c9cd1857375053e148d85f5f5bca

subject: Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 18:38:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/rest_client.py'], 'message': "Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion

The generic rest_client.wait_for_resource_deletion
doesn't put anything into the TimeoutException that's
raised which makes it harder to debug failures.

This follows the pattern in the common waiters module
to put the test information and the resource id into
the TimeoutException message.

Change-Id: Ib0f30f15d5147aab63da35efec2f899e3ca31990
Related-Bug: #1367857
"}]
commit_message:
Better timeout exception in wait_for_resource_deletion

The generic rest_client.wait_for_resource_deletion
doesn't put anything into the TimeoutException that's
raised which makes it harder to debug failures.

This follows the pattern in the common waiters module
to put the test information and the resource id into
the TimeoutException message.

Change-Id: Ib0f30f15d5147aab63da35efec2f899e3ca31990
Related-Bug: #1367857

commit_message:
Use only one configuration file

This patch merge all the configuration file for glance-api and
glance-registry in one configuration (which should be file generated by
oslo.config.generator) and one paste configuration file (with 2
different pipelines).

Change-Id: Ia5395038daf75a7b798f85727e280fbb50deccc7

busy configuration section, and to index/landing page.

commit_message:
Make the extension docs a top level entry in the landing page

Currently any documentation about extensions that Keystone offers
is lacking at best. This patch moves the documentation out of the
busy configuration section, and to index/landing page.

It also provides a brief summary for each extension, and a logical
point of entry for additional information.

Change-Id: Ide8ac9b277e0fc9cab9c01073bb72fe3bc369aed

commit_message:
Add missing gettextutils _ function import

All these modules are not importable on their own because they don't
import the _ function theirself. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: If04a53ede37932ebf812bbef8ce1f93b73a75f34

subject: Expose auth methods on the adapter
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-01 00:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/adapter.py'], 'message': 'Expose auth methods on the adapter

Provide access to get_token, get_endpoint and invalidate to the adapter.
The adapter is essentially created per individual client and it can be
useful to know things like the endpoint that requests will be sent to
based on the parameters that are included in the endpoint_filter.

This essentially allows us to emulate the management_url and auth_token
properties of the existing clients.

Change-Id: Ic01bc52bb38e8fb72e7a6d93bfd2944b11d0b070
'}]
commit_message:
Expose auth methods on the adapter

Provide access to get_token, get_endpoint and invalidate to the adapter.
The adapter is essentially created per individual client and it can be
useful to know things like the endpoint that requests will be sent to
based on the parameters that are included in the endpoint_filter.

This essentially allows us to emulate the management_url and auth_token
properties of the existing clients.

Change-Id: Ic01bc52bb38e8fb72e7a6d93bfd2944b11d0b070

commit_message:
NSX: Correct allowed_address_pair return value on create_port

This patch fixes the NSX plugin to return [] rather than None for a
port does not have any allowed_address_pairs when a create_port api
call is made. Currently the NSX plugin is failing every patch because
now tempest is checking for this value to be [].

Change-Id: Ic82c564ff62000c367c544f44a76694be9375790
Closes-bug: 1366921

commit_message:
Add V3 JSON Home support to GET /

The server wasn't returning a JSON Home response for GET / when the
Accept header is `application/json-home`. By returning the V3 JSON
Home response for GET / a V3 client that supports JSON Home can
GET either /v3 or / and use the response. The identity API should
be able to be set to /.

Closes-Bug: #1366589
Change-Id: I3191a85acf9d2f582f6b48a164cf5ac2bf84a8cf

'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_used_limits.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/views/limits.py'], 'message': 'Add quotas for Server Groups (V2 API compatibility & V2.1 support)

Server groups can be used to control the affinity and anti-affinity
scheduling policy for a group of servers (instances).  Whilst this is
a useful mechanism for users such scheduling decisions need to be
balanced by a deployers requirements to make effective use of the
available capacity.

This change adds quota values to constrain the number and size of
server groups a user can create.

Two new quota values are be introduced to limit the number of server
groups and the number of servers in a server group. These will follow
the existing pattern for quotas in that:

* They are defined by config values, which also include the default
  value

* They can be defined per project or per user within a project

* A value of -1 for either quota will be treated as unlimited

* Defaults can be set via the quota groups API

* Values may be changed at any time but will only take effect at the next
  server group or server create.   Reducing the quota will not affect any
  existing groups, but new servers will not be allowed into group
  that have become over quota.

This is part one of a linked sequences of changes that implement the
new quotas - split to make the reviews easier.

This part adds the definition of the new quota values, but leaves the
V2 API unchanged.  The V2.1 API is updated as it shows all quota values.

The second part adds the new V2 API extension to make the new quota
values visible and changeable.  At this point a Tempest change is
required to get a clean run as it checks for a specific set of
values.

The third part implements the quota checks themselves.

Thanks to Cyril Roelandt for supplying some of the unit tests.

Co-authored-by: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com>

Implements: blueprint server-group-quotas
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib281e43eabfbd176454bde7f0622d46fb04fcb79
'}]
commit_message:
Add quotas for Server Groups (V2 API compatibility & V2.1 support)

Server groups can be used to control the affinity and anti-affinity
scheduling policy for a group of servers (instances).  Whilst this is
a useful mechanism for users such scheduling decisions need to be
balanced by a deployers requirements to make effective use of the
available capacity.

This change adds quota values to constrain the number and size of
server groups a user can create.

Two new quota values are be introduced to limit the number of server
groups and the number of servers in a server group. These will follow
the existing pattern for quotas in that:

* They are defined by config values, which also include the default
  value

* They can be defined per project or per user within a project

* A value of -1 for either quota will be treated as unlimited

* Defaults can be set via the quota groups API

* Values may be changed at any time but will only take effect at the next
  server group or server create.   Reducing the quota will not affect any
  existing groups, but new servers will not be allowed into group
  that have become over quota.

This is part one of a linked sequences of changes that implement the
new quotas - split to make the reviews easier.

This part adds the definition of the new quota values, but leaves the
V2 API unchanged.  The V2.1 API is updated as it shows all quota values.

The second part adds the new V2 API extension to make the new quota
values visible and changeable.  At this point a Tempest change is
required to get a clean run as it checks for a specific set of
values.

The third part implements the quota checks themselves.

Thanks to Cyril Roelandt for supplying some of the unit tests.

Co-authored-by: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com>

Implements: blueprint server-group-quotas
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib281e43eabfbd176454bde7f0622d46fb04fcb79

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-27 00:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_version.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_account_services.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_container_sync.py'], 'message': "Improve the selectability of Swift tests

Before this commit, Tempest tests of Swift were selectable only for WSGI
middleware on proxy servers. With this commit, other following Swift
functions are also selectable with Tempest's config file.

Following Swift functions are selectable now:
 - Old-style Container Sync: mirroring objects in the container to another
   container
 - Object Versioning: versioning all objects in the container
 - Discoverability: providing details about the Swift installation

Change-Id: Idd4afb675c70eea6ba4f8ce59c635f32f040c61e
"}]
commit_message:
Improve the selectability of Swift tests

Before this commit, Tempest tests of Swift were selectable only for WSGI
middleware on proxy servers. With this commit, other following Swift
functions are also selectable with Tempest's config file.

Following Swift functions are selectable now:
 - Old-style Container Sync: mirroring objects in the container to another
   container
 - Object Versioning: versioning all objects in the container
 - Discoverability: providing details about the Swift installation

Implements blueprint more-selectable-swift-tests

Change-Id: Idd4afb675c70eea6ba4f8ce59c635f32f040c61e

commit_message:
Added new filter class for sub-service tables

The same filter class was being run on almost every system info table
despite them having different attributes which was causing horizon to
break. New filter class filters on the 'binary' attribute of the
cinder and nova sub-services.

Change-Id: Idc69a58ee4705280e44bc81bcd429c58da00e6f1
Closes-Bug: 1363250

commit_message:
Sync jsonutils from oslo-incubator 32e7f0b5

Syncs the jsonutils module from oslo-incubator using commit
32e7f0b56f527427544050f251999f3de588ac93 .

Note that since there's a feature change in oslo-incubator I'm
switching to module syncs.

 $ ./update.sh --nodeps --base keystone --dest-dir ../keystone \
     --modules jsonutils

This change includes the following commit
-----------------------------------------
d9060f6 Check for namedtuple_as_object support before using it

Change-Id: I152faacdbb394209f87b91a699bb4ca185c2125e
Closes-Bug: #1361230

subject: Allow swift "min_part_hours" to be configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-04 10:19:52.000000000', 'files': ['elements/swift/os-refresh-config/configure.d/73-swift'], 'message': 'Allow swift "min_part_hours" to be configurable

With swift rings, a "min_part_hours" value is required. This is the
time (in hours) before a specific partition can be moved in succession
(following a rebalance). Currently this value is hard-coded to 1 but
this value is not feasible for a large system and it can often take
several hours for partitions to re-align following a rebalance.

Therefore, this change allows this value to be configurable by adding
the "MIN_PART_HOURS" variable. If this change is accepted, I will add
the relevant parameter in tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: Ie6438386a54794e1ae2f31ad925db01c2c10ed6d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow swift "min_part_hours" to be configurable

With swift rings, a "min_part_hours" value is required. This is the
time (in hours) before a specific partition can be moved in succession
(following a rebalance). Currently this value is hard-coded to 1 but
this value is not feasible for a large system and it can often take
several hours for partitions to re-align following a rebalance.

Therefore, this change allows this value to be configurable by adding
the "MIN_PART_HOURS" variable. If this change is accepted, I will add
the relevant parameter in tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: Ie6438386a54794e1ae2f31ad925db01c2c10ed6d

Change-Id: I417ca06a74c9c8c6dc840f2fd348292073bd5ddf
Closes-Bug: #1368595
'}]
commit_message:
Retype the volume with correct empty QoS

Currently for storwzie driver, if the new type does not have QoS
configurations, the old QoS configurations remain in the volume after retyping
it. It should be retyped into a volume with empty QoS.

Change-Id: I417ca06a74c9c8c6dc840f2fd348292073bd5ddf
Closes-Bug: #1368595

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 13:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/javelin.py'], 'message': 'javelin: fix object destruction

When adding "destroy" support in javelin, a wrong condition has been
introduced to validate if an object has been destroyed or not by its
HTTP return code.

204 is returned and was considered as an error, which is wrong.
Also, delete a resource cleanup dupplication (servers).

Change-Id: I1adaf143ebf2de90d1b2cafc91dcd3a521b96fec
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
javelin: fix object destruction

When adding "destroy" support in javelin, a wrong condition has been
introduced to validate if an object has been destroyed or not by its
HTTP return code.

204 is returned and was considered as an error, which is wrong.
Also, delete a resource cleanup dupplication (servers).

Change-Id: I1adaf143ebf2de90d1b2cafc91dcd3a521b96fec
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

subject: Remove bypassing of H302 for gettextutils markers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 21:07:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove bypassing of H302 for gettextutils markers

When we used the i18n markers (_, _LE, _LW, etc) from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils, we bypassed H302
hacking rule for them (via tox.ini file). Now that we've
converted to using the markers from oslo.i18n and are no
longer using the markers from gettextutils, we can remove
the bypass stuff.

Change-Id: I26147b69884cd9c075e1cfe38a92e38e861083e7
Closes-Bug: #1368425
"}]
commit_message:
Remove bypassing of H302 for gettextutils markers

When we used the i18n markers (_, _LE, _LW, etc) from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils, we bypassed H302
hacking rule for them (via tox.ini file). Now that we've
converted to using the markers from oslo.i18n and are no
longer using the markers from gettextutils, we can remove
the bypass stuff.

Change-Id: I26147b69884cd9c075e1cfe38a92e38e861083e7
Closes-Bug: #1368425

commit_message:
Remove workaround for Ubuntu kernel permissions

Without the dependency on python-guestfs in Icehouse, we no
longer need to provide a workaround for Ubuntu kernel
permission issues on compute nodes.

subject: Fix rootwrap for non openstack.org iqn's
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-29 01:30:06.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters'], 'message': "Fix rootwrap for non openstack.org iqn's

The encryption methods implemented for attached volumes
require a symbolic link created to the /dev/disk-by* iqn.

The current implementation works fine for LVM, however the rootwrap
is restricted to only allow iqns of the form openstack.org, for
vendors that use their own target and iqn this won't work and will
result in the attach failing for unauthorized command.

This just makes the regex for the rootwrap filter a bit more
permissive, only looking for iscsi-iqn.*

Change-Id: I023ad24867c045a88f72c5ac7ac4e4da097a3643
Closes-Bug: 1362854
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rootwrap for non openstack.org iqn's

The encryption methods implemented for attached volumes
require a symbolic link created to the /dev/disk-by* iqn.

The current implementation works fine for LVM, however the rootwrap
is restricted to only allow iqns of the form openstack.org, for
vendors that use their own target and iqn this won't work and will
result in the attach failing for unauthorized command.

This just makes the regex for the rootwrap filter a bit more
permissive, only looking for iscsi-iqn.*

Change-Id: I023ad24867c045a88f72c5ac7ac4e4da097a3643
Closes-Bug: 1362854

subject: LDAP: refactor use of "1.1" OID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 16:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': 'LDAP: refactor use of "1.1" OID

I've noticed several people asking questions about the arbitrary usage
of ['1.1'] in code review, so I figured I'd refactor them into a
constant so it's a bit more self-documenting, since it's definition is,
in fact, completely arbitrary:

    If the client does not want any attributes returned, it can specify
    a list containing only the attribute with OID "1.1". This OID was
    chosen arbitrarily and does not correspond to any attribute in use.

Source: http://www.alvestrand.no/objectid/1.1.html

Change-Id: Ib2901bd8593b5a6ea8b6a5488f0d45b51fa8b77c
'}]
commit_message:
LDAP: refactor use of "1.1" OID

I've noticed several people asking questions about the arbitrary usage
of ['1.1'] in code review, so I figured I'd refactor them into a
constant so it's a bit more self-documenting, since it's definition is,
in fact, completely arbitrary:

    If the client does not want any attributes returned, it can specify
    a list containing only the attribute with OID "1.1". This OID was
    chosen arbitrarily and does not correspond to any attribute in use.

Source: http://www.alvestrand.no/objectid/1.1.html

Change-Id: Ib2901bd8593b5a6ea8b6a5488f0d45b51fa8b77c

Currently, Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

- add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
- move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn

commit_message:
Log translation hint for Heat.api

Currently, Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

- add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
- move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn
- remove use of % as a string formatter, use the log functionality
  instead

Partial implements blueprint log-translation-hints

Change-Id: Ie17871f42f75085c2ac6a14fb1526df7bc3a9603

subject: Reduce unused tox environments
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-09 17:41:43.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'tox-tmpl.ini', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Reduce unused tox environments

Since the openstack-ci only tests 5 of the many tox enviroments
we had listed and from my knowledge nobody else is testing using
those other non-standard enviroments just reduce the set of applicable
environments to the ones that are being used (which also means we
can remove the usage of toxgen and just stick with a simpler file
that is easier to use, modify and adjust).

Change-Id: I4d2302594b9f9e8741f9693cb358efc1418bd45d
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce unused tox environments

Since the openstack-ci only tests 5 of the many tox enviroments
we had listed and from my knowledge nobody else is testing using
those other non-standard enviroments just reduce the set of applicable
environments to the ones that are being used (which also means we
can remove the usage of toxgen and just stick with a simpler file
that is easier to use, modify and adjust).

Change-Id: I4d2302594b9f9e8741f9693cb358efc1418bd45d

commit_message:
Fix service groups with zookeeper

Service groups using zookeeper don't work due to apparently improper
handling of the zookeeper session creation.

No additional unit tests as the mocking these interfaces probably
doesn't actually provide substantial future guaruntees. The correct
long term fix is to enable zk for unit testing upstream.

Change-Id: I21691843cb4936d10a0b82df41aef3afe5bf2519
Closes-bug: #1239864

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-02 09:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/base.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/_data_table.html'], 'message': "Allow adding or changing the CSS classes of a data table

Sometimes a datatable needs to be displayed slightly differently, for
instance with or without the borders, condensed, zebra, etc. This patch
lets us do that in two ways.

It adds a css_class option to table's Meta, so that we can easily add
more classes to a particular table, and modify its looks with CSS.

It also puts the whole table's CSS class list in a block, so that we
can inherit from the table's template to completely replace its classes,
if we need to.

Change-Id: I64a1f3ba8d80643c545de024f52ec3313bbff8e5
"}]
commit_message:
Allow adding or changing the CSS classes of a data table

Sometimes a datatable needs to be displayed slightly differently, for
instance with or without the borders, condensed, zebra, etc. This patch
lets us do that in two ways.

It adds a css_class option to table's Meta, so that we can easily add
more classes to a particular table, and modify its looks with CSS.

It also puts the whole table's CSS class list in a block, so that we
can inherit from the table's template to completely replace its classes,
if we need to.

Change-Id: I64a1f3ba8d80643c545de024f52ec3313bbff8e5

commit_message:
Skip boto instance test with neutron

In [1] I have identified that the boto tests aren't actually running
on Ubuntu due to an error creating the boot images which is undetected
as a failure by devstack.  However, I can not get this change in, as
tempest.thirdparty.boto.test_ec2_instance_run.InstanceRunTest keeps
failing in tearDownClass() due to:

    "Unable to complete operation on subnet [...]. One or more ports
    have an IP allocation from this subnet"

Full logs at [2].  While we are working on this, skip this test on
neutron so other tests don't futher bit-rot

Partial-Bug: #1365831

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113767/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/67/113767/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full/f7610f8/logs/tempest.txt.gz

Change-Id: I626aa32c49233a1c9b59cd471ce4c2860431bd9e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-09 17:53:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/containers/templates/containers/_upload.html'], 'message': 'Enable upload object button without user input.

This fix changes the behaviour of the the "Upload Object" button for Swift to
be enabled by default. There was a check to disable the button if there were
no user changes, but that does not make too much sense since you can only upload
an object if you explicitly change the name of the object.

Change-Id: Ib2d14bec55d858dbc82981336a4373a87bf876e0
Closes-Bug: #1367093
'}]
commit_message:
Enable upload object button without user input.

This fix changes the behaviour of the the "Upload Object" button for Swift to
be enabled by default. There was a check to disable the button if there were
no user changes, but that does not make too much sense since you can only upload
an object if you explicitly change the name of the object.

Change-Id: Ib2d14bec55d858dbc82981336a4373a87bf876e0
Closes-Bug: #1367093

CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE_DEFAULT should be more than 2GB

'}]
commit_message:
Increase CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE_DEFAULT to 4GB

CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE_DEFAULT should be more than 2GB
to make volume snapshot feature works. 2GB is not enough
because min Cinder volume size is 1GB and no snapshot
could be created.

This also fixes related Tempest tests and experimental
check-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph gate job.

Change-Id: Ifa41d0d1764d68ea02dcb32a5fc62f7f6282904d

commit_message:
Remove binding:profile update from Mellanox ML2 MD

Remove temporary work-around that populates physical_network in
binding:profile. Now when both neutron and nova use binding:vif_details
to pass attributes to plug neutron port, this work-around is not nequired.
Remove related temporary code from ML2 plugin.

Change-Id: Ib37203af396f31080b1b27b500a571c20917f5a4
Closes-Bug: 1360762

commit_message:
Fix DBReferenceError on MySQL and SQLite

It turns out the test was wrong as the error message used was not a good
one. Real world tests showed that, so I've updated the test and the code
to work.

Refactored tests to use real backends, fix error message for SQLite.

Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ifa64478a9ac9ed0a3c317a8974615b770c85f313

The store configure() method is being called two times: on one hand
in the store constructor and also explicitly in the create_stores()
method.

Since the configure() method can contain remote calls, it is better

Change-Id: I6f39dfa7fd3d0ef7ff4fc2a9ebbebdfb0cf114a1
"}]
commit_message:
Configure the stores explicitly

The store configure() method is being called two times: on one hand
in the store constructor and also explicitly in the create_stores()
method.

Since the configure() method can contain remote calls, it is better
to avoid calling it more than once, especially, when it doesn't add
any value.

Change-Id: I6f39dfa7fd3d0ef7ff4fc2a9ebbebdfb0cf114a1

subject: Clarify logging in lockutils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 20:08:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'Clarify logging in lockutils

The old logging statements in lockutils made for some confusing log
entries where it would appear a given lock was acquired multiple
times by different threads at the same time.  See referenced bug
for details.

In order to alleviate that confusion, this change does a few things:
1) Adds an explicit "acquired" message inside the lock so it is
   clear when the lock was actually acquired.
2) Moves the release message inside the semaphore so there's no
   chance of it being logged out of order.
3) Removes the "Got semaphore" message and splits it into two
   separate messages depending on whether the semaphore was found
   in the weakref dictionary.  Making it clear which code path
   was followed should help with future debugging.

This is the incubator port of olso.concurrency change
I0fbb473c60d48c9704597d9e3634402857861a66

Change-Id: If863c9d3896bc786f3c9c46196ebb0766e57d863
Closes-Bug: 1367941
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify logging in lockutils

The old logging statements in lockutils made for some confusing log
entries where it would appear a given lock was acquired multiple
times by different threads at the same time.  See referenced bug
for details.

In order to alleviate that confusion, this change does a few things:
1) Adds an explicit "acquired" message inside the lock so it is
   clear when the lock was actually acquired.
2) Moves the release message inside the semaphore so there's no
   chance of it being logged out of order.
3) Removes the "Got semaphore" message and splits it into two
   separate messages depending on whether the semaphore was found
   in the weakref dictionary.  Making it clear which code path
   was followed should help with future debugging.

This is the incubator port of olso.concurrency change
I0fbb473c60d48c9704597d9e3634402857861a66

Change-Id: If863c9d3896bc786f3c9c46196ebb0766e57d863
Closes-Bug: 1367941

commit_message:
Use a new style of semaphore container to see if this fixes

Instead of using a weakref dictionary use a customized container
that we clean up as we consume new semaphores that also has attached
methods to determine when a weak reference is destroyed.

Change-Id: I7e9696fe041fbc6c0be0bd0b72ebf1dcb32488de

commit_message:
Set revoke_api attribute to None on provider object

When an optional extension such as revoke_api is not
included in the pipeline.  Keystone was not setting the attribute to None.
This resulted in validate call raising the following error:

    AttributeError: 'Provider' object has no attribute 'revoke_api'

Change-Id: I15fe304f759cafb6cc5637ede0529571274b4fe0
Closes-bug: #1315049

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 20:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/integrated/test_multiprocess_api.py'], 'message': 'Adds log statements in multiprocess API test

Adds a bunch of INFO logging in the multiprocess API test so that we can
perhaps get some better information to debug with when a timeout
actually occurs for bug #1357578.

Renames the _terminate_workers() method to _wait_for_workers_to_end(),
as that accurately describes what that method was really doing, and adds
a new _terminate_workers() method to actually stop the
workers (used in tearDown() when the test_restart_sighup() method does
not actually stop the API worker processes like the other test methods
do).

Change-Id: I83731fcaeb9265fc46472ef3a505d1184d44bfe8
Related-bug: #1357578
'}]
commit_message:
Adds log statements in multiprocess API test

Adds a bunch of INFO logging in the multiprocess API test so that we can
perhaps get some better information to debug with when a timeout
actually occurs for bug #1357578.

Renames the _terminate_workers() method to _wait_for_workers_to_end(),
as that accurately describes what that method was really doing, and adds
a new _terminate_workers() method to actually stop the
workers (used in tearDown() when the test_restart_sighup() method does
not actually stop the API worker processes like the other test methods
do).

Change-Id: I83731fcaeb9265fc46472ef3a505d1184d44bfe8
Related-bug: #1357578

commit_message:
Adding a periodic task to remove zombie proxy users

Changes
* adding periodic task for user removal
* adding a wrapper function for the periodic tasks class to improve
  configuration
* refactoring proxy user delete function to allow a user id

commit_message:
Refactoring DataSources to use proxy user

Changes
* adding constants for trust id and domain name to swift_helper
* refactoring oozie edp workflows to use proxy configs when necessary
* adding tests to exercise proxy domain usage in workflows
* removing credentials requirement for DataSource models when using
  proxy domain
* pruning duplicate MapReduce test
* adding tests for DataSource creation without credentials
* adding Keystone v3 token endpoint to Hadoop core-site.xml when domain
  requested

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication
Change-Id: I38fd1c470d608c3de9d8c140228d7c9666523b23

commit_message:
Adding trust delegation and removal for proxy users

Changes
* adding a generic keystone client creation function
* adding a function to create proxy user clients
* renaming admin client functions for clarity
* adding token delegation/removal during proxy user creation/deletion
* adding a configuration option for proxy user trust roles

Change-Id: I362a27c1b1d0c5b81d6fbbb91fc0689e339f0076
Partial-implements: blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication

Changes
* adding sahara.utils.proxy module

* adding sanitization for proxy configs from job execution
* adding unit test for proxy usage detection function

Closes-Bug: #1366991

commit_message:
Keystone local authenticate has an unnecessary pending audit record.

Pending should be used for long running operations but local
authenticate is not such an operation.

Change-Id: If06c826c912a973cf133c6dcc6dabe77a392c64a
Closes-Bug: #1366991

commit_message:
List resources with detail

This commit adds support for getting a list of ports, chassis, ports
associated with a node and nodes associated with a chassis with all
attributes, to both the client and the shell CLI.

commit_message:
Update fedora-rdo-icehouse element

This patch takes advantage of the refactoring of the rdo-icehouse
and enable-packages-install bits.  The reactoring allows other
redhat family os elements also use rdo-icehouse and
enable-packages-install.

This patch also deprecates the fedora-rdo-icehouse-repository element
and removes the dependency on it from fedora-rdo-icehouse.

Change-Id: I4e2391d987a05163bc7d45ad03f80c9f6d555681

commit_message:
Add hooks to workaround patching bugs

Add several pre and post patching hooks and tests
for them.

* Stop or migrate corosync services from controller node
  and return them after the deployment

* Stop openstack services and kill pids that was
  not stopped together with their children

* Remove openstack packages before deployment
  to prevent conflicts during the update and rollback

Change-Id: Icfc17308d955e55b5e5b31a9c17e0b6d13d8ba10
Closes-bug: #1364081
Closes-bug: #1365635
Closes-bug: #1364068
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Sharshov <vsharshov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kuklin <vkuklin@mirantis.com>

subject: labs: fix race in preseed script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 11:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['labs/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-vbadd.cfg', 'labs/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-all.cfg'], 'message': 'labs: fix race in preseed script

When using the VirtualBox additions, there is a chance that after the
vboxadd service has started, the shared directory is not yet fully
available. In that case, activate_autostart.sh is never run (although
it may appear in time to be deleted).

This patch makes the script from preseed wait for activate_autostart.sh
to become available before it tries to execute it.

Change-Id: I1c2f3ef2f4301f36efec8a70b811ffe97dbaa779
'}]
commit_message:
labs: fix race in preseed script

When using the VirtualBox additions, there is a chance that after the
vboxadd service has started, the shared directory is not yet fully
available. In that case, activate_autostart.sh is never run (although
it may appear in time to be deleted).

This patch makes the script from preseed wait for activate_autostart.sh
to become available before it tries to execute it.

Change-Id: I1c2f3ef2f4301f36efec8a70b811ffe97dbaa779
