subject: Add transactional test support to provisioning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 11279, 'name': 'Angus Lees', 'email': 'gus@inodes.org', 'username': 'gus'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2014-09-04 17:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/test_base.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_provision.py'], 'message': 'Add transactional test support to provisioning

This patch further reorganizes ProvisionedDatabase
such that it now can maintain a single ProvisionedDatabase
instance across a named "scope".  A "scope" refers
to a series of test runs which can all safely share the
same database schema as well as optional fixture data.

When a test specifies a non-None "scope", the test
is run within a special context that redirects
engine and connection use to a new series of objects
based on a hierarchy called NonCommittingConnectable.
This object produces a facade that behaves like
SQLAlchemy Engine, Connection and Transaction objects
to the degree necessary for a typical database round-trip
test, but ensures that all operations run within a
single transaction that is never committed.   To allow
tests to do real rollbacks, savepoints are used, and the
transaction container always maintains a savepoint
as well for this purpose.

As tests run, if each successive test indicates the
same "scope" as the previous, the database is not dropped,
and the same schema is re-used; all changes to this schema
since the last test ran will have been rolled back.

When a change in scope occurs between tests, the
"drop all objects" routine is run, again so that the
database is not actually dropped, but is instead cleared
of all objects built within it.

Currently, the behavior of ProvisionedDatabase
as a persistent object between tests is only meaningful within
the span of a testr run that calls upon the
testr "instance_execute" and related hooks.  If these
hooks are not called, such as if the tests are run
via a different test runner, or from testtools directly,
there is currently no way for the
provisioning system to have an indication to drop
databases when all tests are complete, so without
instance_execute setting up OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN, the
old behavior of dropping the named database after
each test still takes place.  The ProvisionedDatabase
instance ties its own lifecycle to that of the named database
which it creates; so when dropping the database, the
ProvisionedDatabase itself removes it from the lookup.
On the next lookup for that type of database, a new
ProvisionedDatabase will replace it.

The default scope for any test is None, which
indicates that the scoping feature is not used for
those tests.  However, assuming testr has specified
OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN, the ProvisionedDatabase instance is now
persistent across runs for these tests as well, but at
the end of each test it now runs the "drop all objects"
routine, rather than dropping the whole database.

Partial-Bug: #1339206
Change-Id: I3bca012e2c7655b60cde7085ea55df365219edba
'}]
commit_message:
Add transactional test support to provisioning

This patch further reorganizes ProvisionedDatabase
such that it now can maintain a single ProvisionedDatabase
instance across a named "scope".  A "scope" refers
to a series of test runs which can all safely share the
same database schema as well as optional fixture data.

When a test specifies a non-None "scope", the test
is run within a special context that redirects
engine and connection use to a new series of objects
based on a hierarchy called NonCommittingConnectable.
This object produces a facade that behaves like
SQLAlchemy Engine, Connection and Transaction objects
to the degree necessary for a typical database round-trip
test, but ensures that all operations run within a
single transaction that is never committed.   To allow
tests to do real rollbacks, savepoints are used, and the
transaction container always maintains a savepoint
as well for this purpose.

As tests run, if each successive test indicates the
same "scope" as the previous, the database is not dropped,
and the same schema is re-used; all changes to this schema
since the last test ran will have been rolled back.

When a change in scope occurs between tests, the
"drop all objects" routine is run, again so that the
database is not actually dropped, but is instead cleared
of all objects built within it.

Currently, the behavior of ProvisionedDatabase
as a persistent object between tests is only meaningful within
the span of a testr run that calls upon the
testr "instance_execute" and related hooks.  If these
hooks are not called, such as if the tests are run
via a different test runner, or from testtools directly,
there is currently no way for the
provisioning system to have an indication to drop
databases when all tests are complete, so without
instance_execute setting up OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN, the
old behavior of dropping the named database after
each test still takes place.  The ProvisionedDatabase
instance ties its own lifecycle to that of the named database
which it creates; so when dropping the database, the
ProvisionedDatabase itself removes it from the lookup.
On the next lookup for that type of database, a new
ProvisionedDatabase will replace it.

The default scope for any test is None, which
indicates that the scoping feature is not used for
those tests.  However, assuming testr has specified
OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN, the ProvisionedDatabase instance is now
persistent across runs for these tests as well, but at
the end of each test it now runs the "drop all objects"
routine, rather than dropping the whole database.

Partial-Bug: #1339206
Change-Id: I3bca012e2c7655b60cde7085ea55df365219edba

subject: Add support for per-test-run database provisioning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}, {'_account_id': 12363, 'name': 'Oleksii Chuprykov', 'email': 'a.chuprikoff@gmail.com', 'username': 'ochuprykov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-09-04 17:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Add support for per-test-run database provisioning

A key aspect of being able to use so-called "tranasctional"
testing, that is, testing where the same schema is maintained
across many tests, and data created by the tests is
kept within a non-persistent transaction, is that a single
database node be made available for the duration of many
tests.   The issue that has occurred with this approach
however is that when the tests are run using
multiple, concurrent processes, the concurrent tests
conflict and lock against each other if they are run against
the same database at the same time.

Therefore, this patch provides an all new and optional
system of providing for individual, per-process databases
that last for the lifespan of when they are first needed
until the entire test suite completes.

The entry point for this system is that an environment
variable OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is established local to a
particular test process.  Concurrent test processes would
each have a different value for OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN.

If OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is not set, then the system works
in "ad-hoc" mode, which is exactly how the test runner
has always worked; an ad-hoc database when requested is
created as needed, typically during test setup, and
it is then dropped within the test's cleanup/teardown
phase, that is, the database is created/dropped per test.
This is roughly how openstack database tests run today in any case, so to
that degree, this patch does not remove any existing behavior,
it merely adds an option for an alternative system of
allowing the database to remain persistently, when OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN
is used.

The provisioning system within each process will then
create a database of this name for a particular backend
when a database for that backend is requested; for example,
if a test fixture requires a "postgresql" database and
the value of OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is "xyz", a new postgresql
database "xyz" is created once, and then re-used for all
subsequent tests that request the same type of backend.

The databases can then be dropped by calling upon the
"drop" command at the end of the test run, which can be passed
any number of ad-hoc database names to be dropped; names that
weren't actually created for a particular backend are skipped
so it can be safely called with a full set of names even if
those names were not all used for all backends.

Since the system deals with databases that last throughout
the entire run of tests, running with different kinds of
test runners requires that some kind of "at the end of all
tests" hook be established that will emit the drop command.
There are many ways that this can be achieved, and most test
runners also supply some built-in system of providing such a
hook.  However, there is currently no "standard" system for this
within openstack test suites, and this patch does not attempt
to solve that particular issue across the board.  Approaches
include integration with test runners such as py.test's conftest.py
mechanism, or the use of shell scripts.

As openstack tests have to a large extent standardized on the
use of the testr test runner, at least within continuous integration
systems, integration is proposed here to integrate the system
with testr when it runs, by using the "instance provisioning"
feature of testr and calling upon the "drop" script within
.testr.conf, as well as running an "echo" script to generate
database names up front so that they can be passed through
testr's system.    testr to my knowledge offers no other mechanism for
invoking a global "teardown" feature that runs at the end of each
test process as a whole; if such a system does exist, it can
be proposed in lieu of using .testr.conf.

However it should be noted that the testr integration proposed
here in no way precludes the system from being integrated
with any number of other runners, nor does it imply that
the tests can no longer run with other runners, as the
patch here only offers OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN as an optional system,
disabled by default.   Any mechanism that can run a "cleanup"
step at the end of a full test run can be integrated with
the concept here trivially.

Change-Id: Ibaaefcef2678cc5b985e7c00f05f91b6f02de3f8
Partial-Bug: #1339206
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for per-test-run database provisioning

A key aspect of being able to use so-called "tranasctional"
testing, that is, testing where the same schema is maintained
across many tests, and data created by the tests is
kept within a non-persistent transaction, is that a single
database node be made available for the duration of many
tests.   The issue that has occurred with this approach
however is that when the tests are run using
multiple, concurrent processes, the concurrent tests
conflict and lock against each other if they are run against
the same database at the same time.

Therefore, this patch provides an all new and optional
system of providing for individual, per-process databases
that last for the lifespan of when they are first needed
until the entire test suite completes.

The entry point for this system is that an environment
variable OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is established local to a
particular test process.  Concurrent test processes would
each have a different value for OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN.

If OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is not set, then the system works
in "ad-hoc" mode, which is exactly how the test runner
has always worked; an ad-hoc database when requested is
created as needed, typically during test setup, and
it is then dropped within the test's cleanup/teardown
phase, that is, the database is created/dropped per test.
This is roughly how openstack database tests run today in any case, so to
that degree, this patch does not remove any existing behavior,
it merely adds an option for an alternative system of
allowing the database to remain persistently, when OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN
is used.

The provisioning system within each process will then
create a database of this name for a particular backend
when a database for that backend is requested; for example,
if a test fixture requires a "postgresql" database and
the value of OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN is "xyz", a new postgresql
database "xyz" is created once, and then re-used for all
subsequent tests that request the same type of backend.

The databases can then be dropped by calling upon the
"drop" command at the end of the test run, which can be passed
any number of ad-hoc database names to be dropped; names that
weren't actually created for a particular backend are skipped
so it can be safely called with a full set of names even if
those names were not all used for all backends.

Since the system deals with databases that last throughout
the entire run of tests, running with different kinds of
test runners requires that some kind of "at the end of all
tests" hook be established that will emit the drop command.
There are many ways that this can be achieved, and most test
runners also supply some built-in system of providing such a
hook.  However, there is currently no "standard" system for this
within openstack test suites, and this patch does not attempt
to solve that particular issue across the board.  Approaches
include integration with test runners such as py.test's conftest.py
mechanism, or the use of shell scripts.

As openstack tests have to a large extent standardized on the
use of the testr test runner, at least within continuous integration
systems, integration is proposed here to integrate the system
with testr when it runs, by using the "instance provisioning"
feature of testr and calling upon the "drop" script within
.testr.conf, as well as running an "echo" script to generate
database names up front so that they can be passed through
testr's system.    testr to my knowledge offers no other mechanism for
invoking a global "teardown" feature that runs at the end of each
test process as a whole; if such a system does exist, it can
be proposed in lieu of using .testr.conf.

However it should be noted that the testr integration proposed
here in no way precludes the system from being integrated
with any number of other runners, nor does it imply that
the tests can no longer run with other runners, as the
patch here only offers OSLO_SCHEMA_TOKEN as an optional system,
disabled by default.   Any mechanism that can run a "cleanup"
step at the end of a full test run can be integrated with
the concept here trivially.

Change-Id: Ibaaefcef2678cc5b985e7c00f05f91b6f02de3f8
Partial-Bug: #1339206

commit_message:
Adds "/var/log/messages" to hourly log rotation

Because still many services, including MongoDB, are logging to standard log
destination we should rotate the logs more agressively. Moreover MongoDB in
version 2.4 cannot use LogFacility, so it's easier to fix it in logrotate than
in MonngoDB module itself.

Change-Id: Ice1bbf4a3bf2d453a41d7660b8742a074ec29216
Closes-Bug: 1367234
(cherry picked from commit f686e9ea00eaa9ae141e283ff2b8b28bacd89f72)

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-09-05 16:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/store/test_swift.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'glance/store/swift.py', 'doc/source/configuring.rst', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': 'Add swift store upload recovery

During segmented (chunked) uploads of large files to Swift, if a
single segment fails to upload, Glance will abort the entire
upload, which could have been in progress for many hours.

However, if seek() and tell() methods are provided on the input
file stream, swiftclient will attempt to reset the filestream
back to the beginning of the segment and retry.

This patch adds glance.store.swift.BufferedReader to provide this
reset capability.  It works by buffering the segment/chunk in memory
in case an upload error occurs and a reset is required.  This could
potentially use a much larger amount of memory, so a CONF setting,
CONF.swift_store_reader_class is required to enable the new reader.
(The default is to use the existing glance.store.swift.ChunkReader.)

Change-Id: I7d7337cee930fd2fb451fa5c7093c5fa9f985dcb
Closes-Bug: 1235386
DocImpact
'}]
commit_message:
Add swift store upload recovery

During segmented (chunked) uploads of large files to Swift, if a
single segment fails to upload, Glance will abort the entire
upload, which could have been in progress for many hours.

However, if seek() and tell() methods are provided on the input
file stream, swiftclient will attempt to reset the filestream
back to the beginning of the segment and retry.

This patch adds glance.store.swift.BufferedReader to provide this
reset capability.  It works by buffering the segment/chunk in memory
in case an upload error occurs and a reset is required.  This could
potentially use a much larger amount of memory, so a CONF setting,
CONF.swift_store_reader_class is required to enable the new reader.
(The default is to use the existing glance.store.swift.ChunkReader.)

Change-Id: I7d7337cee930fd2fb451fa5c7093c5fa9f985dcb
Closes-Bug: 1235386
DocImpact

commit_message:
Adds "/var/log/messages" to hourly log rotation

Because still many services, including MongoDB, are logging to standard log
destination we should rotate the logs more agressively. Moreover MongoDB in
version 2.4 cannot use LogFacility, so it's easier to fix it in logrotate than
in MonngoDB module itself.

Change-Id: Ice1bbf4a3bf2d453a41d7660b8742a074ec29216
Closes-Bug: 1367234
(cherry picked from commit f686e9ea00eaa9ae141e283ff2b8b28bacd89f72)

commit_message:
Forbid remove all controllers at once

same time, since it affects cluster's availability.

(cherry picked from commit ac23dc36eecbcbb5aba202dbcc63fbf774149dae)

revisions:

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: Iace038faf5d2a22bf797f5cbb9433ff027b2101e
'}]
commit_message:
Auto generate the API documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: Iace038faf5d2a22bf797f5cbb9433ff027b2101e

commit_message:
Add Keystone URI to 401 responces

Instead of using a catch-all "Swift" authentication scheme, if
keystone client provides HTTP_X_AUTH_URI or auth_uri is specified
in the [filter:keystoneauth], the Keystone uri is returned.

Closes-Bug: 1349364
Change-Id: I27105cbcabb471d6cfd580cf9d98dc1388886aba

commit_message:
labs: exit if ssh returns error value

With this changeset, osbash host scripts abort installation over ssh if
script execution in the VM returns an error. The patch has no effect on
installations using VirtualBox guest-addons.

Change-Id: Ibc0b297f44289cfe37e07fad1c0fcef1a30abfb2

commit_message:
Make fedora-rdo-icehouse-repository more generic

Nothing tied this element to be Fedora only. It can also be used for
RHEL. And it could also be used for any RDO release not just icehouse.

There fore this element has been renamed to rdo-repository.

Removed the element-deps that was including the "fedora" element.
Updated the README to make it clearer that it could be used for both
Fedora and RHEL.

Change-Id: I8724203de7c37f083ab3f6cf4cdd134946f643da

commit_message:
handles keyboard interrupt

When an user intentionally provides an keyboard interrupt, ironicclient
throws the entire traceback on to the terminal instead of handling it.
ironicclient will now handle the keyboard interrrupt and provides an crisp
message on to the terminal.

Change-Id: I8e657dc0cf64fa3396fb8fd32c5ffb57016ce864
Closes-Bug: #1367283

commit_message:
Rally needs bumping python-novaclient

python-novaclient <= 2.17 doesn't support authentification via
auth_token (at least without specifing username and password)

Which was changed here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85920/

So it makes sense to bump version of novaclient

Change-Id: I6d2a0a414b89e757a48d6616c8e74ed34591d02b

This test is not reliable. Whenever it's executed outside a git repo or
with a repo that has uncommited changes, it fails. Since this code has
been stable for quite some time and it won't likely change in the
future, I think it's safe to remove this test.

Change-Id: I39a3dbd01ef189571f6dcf3ab4cd7a476733950a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove test_correct_has from our test suite

This test is not reliable. Whenever it's executed outside a git repo or
with a repo that has uncommited changes, it fails. Since this code has
been stable for quite some time and it won't likely change in the
future, I think it's safe to remove this test.

Change-Id: I39a3dbd01ef189571f6dcf3ab4cd7a476733950a

zaqar client has a client discovery function that should be used instead

Change-Id: I294e56cedd8fd0a9ec7f4cc01d8396fd3edb2335

commit_message:
Don't import client from the version package

zaqar client has a client discovery function that should be used instead
of the client module in the version package. This patch fixes that issue
in our benchmark tool by importing the right client module.

Change-Id: I294e56cedd8fd0a9ec7f4cc01d8396fd3edb2335

subject: Fix issue with intermittent test failures in test_pkg.py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-09 11:28:15.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_pkg.py'], 'message': "Fix issue with intermittent test failures in test_pkg.py

The test failures were a result of randomized test order and the way
in which these tests were setting up mocks for pexpect.spawn.expect
and pexpect.spawn.match.

The code now mocks pexpect.spawn and then sets return values and match
in each test as appropriate. Code in setUp establishes a patch and a
cleanUp function is added to reverse the patch. No code is required in
tearDown as a result.

execute() was being Mocked using code in setUp and tearDown and this
was replaced that with a similar patch in setUp with a corresponding
cleanUp function to reverse its effects.

Since we're close to Juno, I've not gone down the path of converting
this test to use a fixture which would further reduce duplicated code.

Change-Id: I3edfd499823f2c2f4591e709384a24f1b55abe5a
Closes-Bug: 1365531
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with intermittent test failures in test_pkg.py

The test failures were a result of randomized test order and the way
in which these tests were setting up mocks for pexpect.spawn.expect
and pexpect.spawn.match.

The code now mocks pexpect.spawn and then sets return values and match
in each test as appropriate. Code in setUp establishes a patch and a
cleanUp function is added to reverse the patch. No code is required in
tearDown as a result.

execute() was being Mocked using code in setUp and tearDown and this
was replaced that with a similar patch in setUp with a corresponding
cleanUp function to reverse its effects.

Since we're close to Juno, I've not gone down the path of converting
this test to use a fixture which would further reduce duplicated code.

Change-Id: I3edfd499823f2c2f4591e709384a24f1b55abe5a
Closes-Bug: 1365531

commit_message:
Add entry-point for oslo.config options and update registering logic

1. The change exposed all options of store and driver by oslo.config
entry-point.
2. Refactor store and driver options registering logic to leverage this
unified option discover function.

commit_message:
Libvirt-Enable support for discard option for disk device

Support setting discard option for instance's disk.
If discard option is enabled, unused/freed blocks can be return back to the
storage device.

blueprint libvirt-disk-discard-option
DocImpact: Add a new configuration in nova.conf

Change-Id: Ic87b9348a2e441d5df0b468bb88ec6e77f8b4ce2

commit_message:
make the bind_port config setting required

In a long-term effort to change the recommended ports for Swift,
the first step is to require the bind_port in config files. Later,
we can change the recommended setting.

Anyone currently explicitly setting the ports will not be affected.
Anyone not setting the ports will need to specify them to match their
rings.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icca83a263acdd0afc9016424a3e9f8c15e944789

subject: Add 'bash-completion' to 'ironic help' response
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-09 15:18:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'ironicclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Add 'bash-completion' to 'ironic help' response

If you do 'ironic' or 'ironic help', it will show a list of subcommands.
This adds 'bash-completion' to that list.

The 'ironic bash-completion' subcommand lists all of the commands.
It won't include 'bash-completion' in this list, to be consistent with
nova's and keystone's bash-completion subcommand.

Change-Id: I7f2b76ad2885d9fe34dc91a97ee77984a21a27f4
Closes-Bug: #1304488
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'bash-completion' to 'ironic help' response

If you do 'ironic' or 'ironic help', it will show a list of subcommands.
This adds 'bash-completion' to that list.

The 'ironic bash-completion' subcommand lists all of the commands.
It won't include 'bash-completion' in this list, to be consistent with
nova's and keystone's bash-completion subcommand.

Change-Id: I7f2b76ad2885d9fe34dc91a97ee77984a21a27f4
Closes-Bug: #1304488

Before, the error message in `error_msg` could be too generic. It is
possible to add the `fault.text` containing some more infomation to the
error message.

commit_message:
Adds "/var/log/messages" to hourly log rotation

Because still many services, including MongoDB, are logging to standard log
destination we should rotate the logs more agressively. Moreover MongoDB in
version 2.4 cannot use LogFacility, so it's easier to fix it in logrotate than
in MonngoDB module itself.

Change-Id: Ice1bbf4a3bf2d453a41d7660b8742a074ec29216
Closes-Bug: 1367234

subject: Fix regression in swift store functional test
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-05 16:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/store/test_swift.py'], 'message': 'Fix regression in swift store functional test

Fix regression introduced by commit
63195aaa3b12e56ae787598e001ac44d62e52865.  The commit populated a
singleton in glance.store.swift at import time to hold the swift
configuration.  The functional test, however, relies on tweaking
the config after importing the glance.store.swift module.

Change-Id: I5550dd591bcf0c62071635506780be51d560d597
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression in swift store functional test

Fix regression introduced by commit
63195aaa3b12e56ae787598e001ac44d62e52865.  The commit populated a
singleton in glance.store.swift at import time to hold the swift
configuration.  The functional test, however, relies on tweaking
the config after importing the glance.store.swift module.

Change-Id: I5550dd591bcf0c62071635506780be51d560d597

commit_message:
Revert "Repair pysqlite transaction support"

This reverts commit 78fd290a89545de31e5c13f3085df23368a8afaa.

Unfortunally, this commit breaks unittests in Nova, Neutron and
Keystone. It's would be nice to adopt these projects, but it seems
to be, that we will do in in K release

Change-Id: Idf8ffa71fcd4aae476e1983762358f5087d370b3
Closes-Bug: #1367354

commit_message:
Added simple samples that exercise autoscaling

Added trivial templates that can be used to exercise basic
scaling group functionality: the mechanics of the scaling
actions.  These examples are deliberately spare, to
minimize dependencies.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-08 16:13:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Removed direct access to MessagingServer

Factory method provided by the library should be used to create a server
object. This allows to change servers internal implementation without
touching end users.

Also removed custom dispatcher. Its only purpose was to log messages.
If logging is configured accordingly all incoming messages will be
logged from oslo/messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py [1]

[1] http://goo.gl/nV9tcu

Closes-Bug: #1357236

Change-Id: Ic208994c5a64fd48528cb41d30a975d68d84af05
'}]
commit_message:
Removed direct access to MessagingServer

Factory method provided by the library should be used to create a server
object. This allows to change servers internal implementation without
touching end users.

Also removed custom dispatcher. Its only purpose was to log messages.
If logging is configured accordingly all incoming messages will be
logged from oslo/messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py [1]

[1] http://goo.gl/nV9tcu

Closes-Bug: #1357236

Change-Id: Ic208994c5a64fd48528cb41d30a975d68d84af05

[{'number': 23, 'created': '2014-09-09 23:50:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: start lxc from block device

Currently, lxc containers can be started only from an image.
Adding support to start lxc containers from block device volumes.

Separating the lxc disk handling code from _create_domain to _lxc_disk_handler
that will use block_device_mapping and will handle the pre and post lxc start
actions on the disk, both for images and volumes.

Implements blueprint libvirt-start-lxc-from-block-devices
Change-Id: Ia980f65384af2818f46d2e91df46f131b2ce3a77
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: start lxc from block device

Currently, lxc containers can be started only from an image.
Adding support to start lxc containers from block device volumes.

Separating the lxc disk handling code from _create_domain to _lxc_disk_handler
that will use block_device_mapping and will handle the pre and post lxc start
actions on the disk, both for images and volumes.

Implements blueprint libvirt-start-lxc-from-block-devices
Change-Id: Ia980f65384af2818f46d2e91df46f131b2ce3a77

subject: Fix broken www-authenticate functional test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-11 09:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/tests.py'], 'message': 'Fix broken www-authenticate functional test

testQuotedWWWAuthenticateHeader functional test started failing
due to a change to keystonemiddleware.auth_token, which now adds
its own www-authenticate header in addition to the one that swift
keystoneauth adds.

This patch changes the functional test to check expected
swift generated header value is in the concatenation of
www-authenticate values.

Verified that functional tests still pass using tempauth.

Closes-Bug: 1368048
Change-Id: I913af077df800a559d259c1622f286ad10eae9df
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken www-authenticate functional test

testQuotedWWWAuthenticateHeader functional test started failing
due to a change to keystonemiddleware.auth_token, which now adds
its own www-authenticate header in addition to the one that swift
keystoneauth adds.

This patch changes the functional test to check expected
swift generated header value is in the concatenation of
www-authenticate values.

Verified that functional tests still pass using tempauth.

Closes-Bug: 1368048
Change-Id: I913af077df800a559d259c1622f286ad10eae9df

commit_message:
Fix exception that is not properly raised

This commit fixes an exception that was not properly raised, and
also makes the exception more relevant.

This also fixes an outstanding bug where, if the agent
was not associated with a node, get_node_uuid() would fail in an
unexpected manner.

subject: Ensure lock list isn't mutated while iterating
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 06:18:46.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/memcached.py'], 'message': "Ensure lock list isn't mutated while iterating

While iterating over the acquired lock list we
do not want the lock.release call to mutate the
list that we are currently iterating over. To fix
this just iterate over a copy instead so that the
lock.release can remove without issue.

Change-Id: I157331ca116b97e17d10854b5227ac7ee67fac57
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure lock list isn't mutated while iterating

While iterating over the acquired lock list we
do not want the lock.release call to mutate the
list that we are currently iterating over. To fix
this just iterate over a copy instead so that the
lock.release can remove without issue.

Change-Id: I157331ca116b97e17d10854b5227ac7ee67fac57

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-28 19:08:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Translate Unauthorized NeutronClientException to NovaException

Requests to Neutron can fail during authentication when the auth_token
passed from Nova to Neutron via the client expires and this results in a
500 error in the Nova response. Rather than fail with a 500 error we can
handle the Unauthorized exception from the client and translate it to a
more specific NovaException, the new Unauthorized NovaException in this
case.

This patch only wraps the allocate/deallocate_for_instance methods but
can probably also be applied to more methods in the neutronv2 API.

Closes-Bug: #1298075

Change-Id: I00479b8e2fc04e995f6e0e90d3e24de8c939178c
'}]
commit_message:
Translate Unauthorized NeutronClientException to NovaException

Requests to Neutron can fail during authentication when the auth_token
passed from Nova to Neutron via the client expires and this results in a
500 error in the Nova response. Rather than fail with a 500 error we can
handle the Unauthorized exception from the client and translate it to a
more specific NovaException, the new Unauthorized NovaException in this
case.

This patch only wraps the allocate/deallocate_for_instance methods but
can probably also be applied to more methods in the neutronv2 API.

Closes-Bug: #1298075

Change-Id: I00479b8e2fc04e995f6e0e90d3e24de8c939178c

commit_message:
Add hooks to workaround patching bugs

Add several pre and post patching hooks and tests
for them.

* Stop or migrate corosync services from controller node
  and return them after the deployment

* Stop openstack services and kill pids that was
  not stopped together with their children

* Remove openstack packages before deployment
  to prevent conflicts during the update and rollback

Change-Id: Icfc17308d955e55b5e5b31a9c17e0b6d13d8ba10
Closes-bug: #1364081
Closes-bug: #1365635
Closes-bug: #1364068
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Sharshov <vsharshov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kuklin <vkuklin@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2014-09-09 18:24:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'Add claims testing to VirtNUMAHostTopology class

This will allow us to use NUMA topology information from hosts and
instances when making resource claims for scheduling and migrating
instances.

This patch adds the VirtNUMALimitTopology class and corresponding
cells class that are used to represent the limits, and a method
claim_test() on the VirtNUMAHostTopology class that does the checking.

Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement
Change-Id: Ic21d559edf292e5b5dc1bba966e10ec4af0f706e
'}]
commit_message:
Add claims testing to VirtNUMAHostTopology class

This will allow us to use NUMA topology information from hosts and
instances when making resource claims for scheduling and migrating
instances.

This patch adds the VirtNUMALimitTopology class and corresponding
cells class that are used to represent the limits, and a method
claim_test() on the VirtNUMAHostTopology class that does the checking.

Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement
Change-Id: Ic21d559edf292e5b5dc1bba966e10ec4af0f706e

commit_message:
Add the ability to extract the query params from a urlsplit

The query params are quite useful to have (in collapsed or
non-collapsed modes) by applications that want to use urls
in situations where these params actually matter and are used
to do things like configure settings...

Change-Id: Iaf1b6a98f4152482d2f991b9dc7e4e24664c8b80

commit_message:
Replace "tenant" with "project" in visible strings

OpenStack Dashboard uses "Project" rather than "Tenant" throughout
the code base. Only a few string with "tenant" are remaining,
and this commit cleans them up.

This commit also replaces "Id/id" with "ID"
for consistency in visible strings.

Change-Id: I2908ea16eb2d4f27af1e9ad0d653d790fab2faae
Closes-Bug: #1366973

When a slave is attached to a master site, this change will
mark the slave site as read-only to prevent the slave site
from being updated by users.  Only users with root privileges
or slave priveleges will be able to update the database.

Change-Id: Idb6c54b85a23af9a468ff9d62b3110fa72ff7da0
Closes-bug: #1359392
'}]
commit_message:
Marks mysql slave read-only

When a slave is attached to a master site, this change will
mark the slave site as read-only to prevent the slave site
from being updated by users.  Only users with root privileges
or slave priveleges will be able to update the database.

Change-Id: Idb6c54b85a23af9a468ff9d62b3110fa72ff7da0
Closes-bug: #1359392

commit_message:
Add baremetal API tests about console

This patch set adds tests og below Ironic APIs:

* GET /v1/nodes/(node_uuid)/states/console

commit_message:
Search line with awk itself and avoid grep

In ssh driver, some command sets are needlessly long.
"awk" command can search line itself. This fixes it.

subject: Make requests requirement !=2.4.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 19:37:29.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Make requests requirement !=2.4.0

There is a bug in requests 2.4.0 which causes the ec2 collector to fail.
Fixing this would require us digging below our requests abstraction so
electing to pin the requests version.

Upstream bug: https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/2192

Change-Id: I471463e3b82cfb6ba910ebf75cfbf5ecebb56b4e
'}]
commit_message:
Make requests requirement !=2.4.0

There is a bug in requests 2.4.0 which causes the ec2 collector to fail.
Fixing this would require us digging below our requests abstraction so
electing to pin the requests version.

Upstream bug: https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/issues/2192

Change-Id: I471463e3b82cfb6ba910ebf75cfbf5ecebb56b4e

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-09-03 17:03:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/generic_resource.py'], 'message': "Log translation hint for Heat.tests

Currently, Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

- add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
- move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn

commit_message:
Log translation hint for Heat.tests

Currently, Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

- add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
- move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn
- remove use of % as a string formatter, use the log functionality
  instead

Partial implements blueprint log-translation-hints

Change-Id: Ia961196df09d301b4c384ffe51413ffc5c15164e

commit_message:
Log translation hint for Heat.common

Currently, Log translation is motivated by oslo's move to prioritized
translation of strings, as documented at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards#Log_Translation

- add log translation hints for warning, error and info levels
- move from LOG.warning to LOG.warn
- remove use of % as a string formatter, use the log functionality
  instead

Partial implements blueprint log-translation-hints

Change-Id: I715f69154bd199dabac7d537b982b875204f8b33

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 8576, 'name': 'Yair Fried', 'email': 'yfried@redhat.com', 'username': 'yfried'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10723, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-09-09 06:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Migrate security_groups_basic to tempest clients

Adds client argument to various helper methods, so methods would work in tenant
context. In these methods tenant_id is either an input or retrieved from
client's rest_client arguments
Argument tenant_id is kept for legacy reasons, but it's not needed. When
working with native clients, network_client used to be loaded with admin creds.
Since this is no longer the case, tenant_id is no longer required for most
cases, and can be deduced from client.

Change-Id: Iaaa6b3b8dde22e1dd4da604ab35211d75d0ae5c6
Partially-implements: bp:tempest-client-scenarios
"}]
commit_message:
Migrate security_groups_basic to tempest clients

Adds client argument to various helper methods, so methods would work in tenant
context. In these methods tenant_id is either an input or retrieved from
client's rest_client arguments
Argument tenant_id is kept for legacy reasons, but it's not needed. When
working with native clients, network_client used to be loaded with admin creds.
Since this is no longer the case, tenant_id is no longer required for most
cases, and can be deduced from client.

Change-Id: Iaaa6b3b8dde22e1dd4da604ab35211d75d0ae5c6
Partially-implements: bp:tempest-client-scenarios

subject: Change pacemaker default no-quorum-policy to 'stop'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 11:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['elements/pacemaker/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/16-base-opts-pacemaker'], 'message': "Change pacemaker default no-quorum-policy to 'stop'

Currently we use 'ignore' policy which makes sense for 2-nodes
clusters. Setting 'stop' policy makes sure that resources are stopped
in affected cluster partition.

Change-Id: I73dd5670713d0b6f93482ee1d7a14bac7e68ce1f
"}]
commit_message:
Change pacemaker default no-quorum-policy to 'stop'

Currently we use 'ignore' policy which makes sense for 2-nodes
clusters. Setting 'stop' policy makes sure that resources are stopped
in affected cluster partition.

Change-Id: I73dd5670713d0b6f93482ee1d7a14bac7e68ce1f

subject: Cherry pick Nova fix for extra_specs bug
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-11 05:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Cherry pick Nova fix for extra_specs bug

Cherry pick a Nova fix that resolves a scheduling error due to
the fact that extra_specs data was being canonicalized in the
Ironic driver but not in the relevant Nova scheduler filters.

Also, removes the previous Ironic temprevert that is no
longer needed (the Ironic drivers now subclass the Nova ones).

Change-Id: I45f3e0401709435ccf96d69e1703a880d40b8660
'}]
commit_message:
Cherry pick Nova fix for extra_specs bug

Cherry pick a Nova fix that resolves a scheduling error due to
the fact that extra_specs data was being canonicalized in the
Ironic driver but not in the relevant Nova scheduler filters.

Also, removes the previous Ironic temprevert that is no
longer needed (the Ironic drivers now subclass the Nova ones).

Change-Id: I45f3e0401709435ccf96d69e1703a880d40b8660

commit_message:
Precompilation of expressions

- performance boost in case of precompilation about ~50 times
- no exceptions in case of missing keys if expression part
which is using the key is not evaluated

Change-Id: I3c883f390f1ebe886799bc0215e00a21647b127c

commit_message:
Corrected AZ FilterAction and table filter

The Availability Zone table was using the Host Aggregates filter action
so that has been changed to use the correct filter action, and fixed
Availability Zone filter action accessing an attribute that did not exist.

Change-Id: Ib9daaaeffade0ee30115f47f065f9f86ec6eb70c
Closes-Bug: 1362850

commit_message:
Version independent plugins

A Framework for creating plugins that work across identity versions.
Upon creating a generic plugin the plugin will go and discover what
versions are available on the server and then attemp to construct a
suitable plugin.

Blueprint: version-independant-plugins
Change-Id: If7fed94aaf4636e80a9c3a834cf6c5430f20e489

revisions:
[{'number': 107, 'created': '2014-09-08 00:55:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fake_imagebackend.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/dmcrypt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Adds ephemeral storage encryption for LVM back-end images

This patch adds ephemeral storage encryption for LVM back-end instances.
Encryption is implemented by passing all data written to and read from
the logical volumes through a dm-crypt layer. Most instance operations
such as pause/continue, suspend/resume, reboot, etc. are supported.
Snapshots are also supported but are not encrypted at present. VM rescue
and migration are not supported at present.

The proposed code provides data-at-rest security for all ephemeral
storage disks, preventing access to data while an instance is
shut down, or in case the compute host is shut down while an instance is
running.

Options controlling the encryption state, cipher and key size are
specified in the "ephemeral_storage_encryption" options group. The boolean
"enabled" option turns encryption on and off and the "cipher" and "key_size"
options specify the cipher and key size, respectively.

Note: depends on cryptsetup being installed.

Implements: blueprint lvm-ephemeral-storage-encryption
Change-Id: I871af4018f99ddfcc8408708bdaaf480088ac477
DocImpact
SecurityImpact
'}]
commit_message:
Adds ephemeral storage encryption for LVM back-end images

This patch adds ephemeral storage encryption for LVM back-end instances.
Encryption is implemented by passing all data written to and read from
the logical volumes through a dm-crypt layer. Most instance operations
such as pause/continue, suspend/resume, reboot, etc. are supported.
Snapshots are also supported but are not encrypted at present. VM rescue
and migration are not supported at present.

The proposed code provides data-at-rest security for all ephemeral
storage disks, preventing access to data while an instance is
shut down, or in case the compute host is shut down while an instance is
running.

Options controlling the encryption state, cipher and key size are
specified in the "ephemeral_storage_encryption" options group. The boolean
"enabled" option turns encryption on and off and the "cipher" and "key_size"
options specify the cipher and key size, respectively.

Note: depends on cryptsetup being installed.

Implements: blueprint lvm-ephemeral-storage-encryption
Change-Id: I871af4018f99ddfcc8408708bdaaf480088ac477
DocImpact
SecurityImpact

commit_message:
Allow out of quota failure status code to be 413 or 403

Due to HTTP response code changes for Bug 1298131, tempest skip
some cases to have jenkins pass. As nova change is merged now,
remove these skip tags. Also need to allow both HTTP413 and
HTTP403 because branchless Tempest needs to support both master and
icehouse/stable branches.

Change-Id: Iee392859a9fd1eec767cbf6292290d5b3ad7dcca
Related-Bug: #1298131

The first part of the commit is to re-propose the v3 auth changes.

The second part of the commit is to address the unexpected keyword
argument 'follow_redirect' and missing endpoint issue in certain

With the fix, follow_redirect argument is consumed by

commit_message:
Re-add keystone v3 auth with fixes

The first part of the commit is to re-propose the v3 auth changes.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/92728/

The second part of the commit is to address the unexpected keyword
argument 'follow_redirect' and missing endpoint issue in certain
code path such as 'heat event-list' or 'heat resource-metadata'.
With the fix, follow_redirect argument is consumed by
SessionClient.  Heat endpoint is now passed from Heatclient
shell to SessionClient.

Unit tests were added and updated to cover the issue.

Change-Id: I0cdf837c924afe9cbd8826bdca5dd611c183efeb
Closes-Bug: #1349467
Closes-Bug: #1348297

commit_message:
Expose numa_topology to the resource tracker

This patch makes all the current drivers that implement
get_available_resource() return an additional 'numa_topology' field in
the resources dict. The libvirt driver will actually return useful data,
while other drivers only return 'None' at this time.

We also make the resource tracker check for the presence of this field.
The intent is that it be mandatory for all drivers to expose, but to
avoid breaking out of tree virt drivers, if the field is missing it
will be set to None.

Blueprint: virt-driver-numa-placement
Change-Id: I75e4aeea4636532cfd724f718e136fac5bb2d15e

subject: Always add auth URI to unauthorized requests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-05 03:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py'], 'message': 'Always add auth URI to unauthorized requests

For those services that use delay_auth_decision we need to support
adding the keystone URI rejection headers to the response in a uniform
way. I feel this should be more generic and that every 401 response
should contain this header.

Create a WSGI wrapper so that if a 401 is ever returned through
auth_token middleware we can add an additional WWW-Authenticate header.

Closes-Bug: #1349364
Change-Id: Ib5231a09fd5c6cb6cd17f07c87e982d2e8fde2bf
'}]
commit_message:
Always add auth URI to unauthorized requests

For those services that use delay_auth_decision we need to support
adding the keystone URI rejection headers to the response in a uniform
way. I feel this should be more generic and that every 401 response
should contain this header.

Create a WSGI wrapper so that if a 401 is ever returned through
auth_token middleware we can add an additional WWW-Authenticate header.

Closes-Bug: #1349364
Change-Id: Ib5231a09fd5c6cb6cd17f07c87e982d2e8fde2bf

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-09 18:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance_numa_topology.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_instance_numa_topology.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Add instance_extra_update_by_uuid() to DB API

Since we have multiple things reading from and writing to the
instance_extra table, we really need a way to just update the value
in a single column, by instance_uuid, without looking it up first,
without wiping the other columns, or updating them with stale data
introducing a race.

This adds the new API, updates instance_create() to pre-create the
extra record, and makes the numa_topology object do this sort of
update instead of creating the record itself. As a result of this
change, we no longer need instance_extra_create() exposed out of
the DB API.

Change-Id: I0819cab81467ab41551e8937be7443a7761cbfb8
'}]
commit_message:
Add instance_extra_update_by_uuid() to DB API

Since we have multiple things reading from and writing to the
instance_extra table, we really need a way to just update the value
in a single column, by instance_uuid, without looking it up first,
without wiping the other columns, or updating them with stale data
introducing a race.

This adds the new API, updates instance_create() to pre-create the
extra record, and makes the numa_topology object do this sort of
update instead of creating the record itself. As a result of this
change, we no longer need instance_extra_create() exposed out of
the DB API.

Change-Id: I0819cab81467ab41551e8937be7443a7761cbfb8

commit_message:
Add pci_requests to instance_extra table

Add a new text column, pci_requests, to the instance_extra table.
This column will be used to hold the data that is currently stored in
instance system_metadata.  The problem with its current location is
the 255 character limit, which becomes a more serious limitation with
the coming SR-IOV support.

Related to blueprint pci-passthrough-sriov

Change-Id: I84d02242c56ad56c597fe588407aaceb24910d0a

[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-09-05 22:24:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix AttributeError when setting external gateway on DVR router

DVR routers will have this manager initialized only after one
or more subnets have been attached to the router. To address
the issue, make sure the manager is defined and handle the snat
rules appropriately.

This patch also makes _update_arp_entry more defensive; this is
because the arp update process can be affected by the same issue:
the router may not have internal ports at the time the request
come in. This is likely when VM's port creation and router
configuration overlap slightly.

Closes-bug: #1353006

Change-Id: Ib46852f5b264e5ef2e2d499d3351f8974e393011
Co-authored-by: Rajeev Grover <rajeev.grover@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError when setting external gateway on DVR router

DVR routers will have this manager initialized only after one
or more subnets have been attached to the router. To address
the issue, make sure the manager is defined and handle the snat
rules appropriately.

This patch also makes _update_arp_entry more defensive; this is
because the arp update process can be affected by the same issue:
the router may not have internal ports at the time the request
come in. This is likely when VM's port creation and router
configuration overlap slightly.

Closes-bug: #1353006

Change-Id: Ib46852f5b264e5ef2e2d499d3351f8974e393011
Co-authored-by: Rajeev Grover <rajeev.grover@hp.com>

commit_message:
Reset IPv6 detection flag after IPv6 tests

Resets a module level flag that was being left in the
state that the previous test set it to. This was causing
unrelated tests to fail if the last state was left disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1365829
Change-Id: Id3f6cb680f5d832e21966de7d4fa335c0c59697c

subject: Stop having jsonutils place itself into anyjson
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-30 07:18:10.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'taskflow/openstack/common/jsonutils.py'], 'message': 'Stop having jsonutils place itself into anyjson

In order to avoid the case where libraries that use
taskflow (or vice-versa) pickup taskflows jsonutils
due to how jsonutils auto-registers with anyjson just
remove that registration process to begin with.

Since jsonutils is no longer being maintained we will
have to start patching these types of additions in
ourselves until/if we can use oslo.serialization as
a suitable replacement.

This mirrors the change in:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117844/

Change-Id: I5fe9e98f821fcd4e2904853de1a203141a6833f3
'}]
commit_message:
Stop having jsonutils place itself into anyjson

In order to avoid the case where libraries that use
taskflow (or vice-versa) pickup taskflows jsonutils
due to how jsonutils auto-registers with anyjson just
remove that registration process to begin with.

Since jsonutils is no longer being maintained we will
have to start patching these types of additions in
ourselves until/if we can use oslo.serialization as
a suitable replacement.

This mirrors the change in:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117844/

Change-Id: I5fe9e98f821fcd4e2904853de1a203141a6833f3

Closes-Bug: #1361444

commit_message:
Always supply a username to auth_token tests setup

Whilst the v2.Password plugin (which is used by default) will accept a
None value for username this is incorrect behaviour. We should always
provide at least a username so that the plugin can do sensible error
handling if it is not present.

Change-Id: Id790b52f3b06240923f605754c7ffcf4ff136062
Closes-Bug: #1361444

subject: Allow passing None for username in v2.Password
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-26 00:36:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/auth/test_identity_v2.py', 'keystoneclient/auth/identity/v2.py'], 'message': 'Allow passing None for username in v2.Password

None must be an acceptable parameter for username in password due to
tests in other libraries, however we should still raise an error if
neither username or user_id is passed. Use and check a sentinel value
instead of None.

Change-Id: Id61cfd1423afa8f9dd964fda278f4fab40887512
Closes-Bug: #1361444
'}]
commit_message:
Allow passing None for username in v2.Password

None must be an acceptable parameter for username in password due to
tests in other libraries, however we should still raise an error if
neither username or user_id is passed. Use and check a sentinel value
instead of None.

Change-Id: Id61cfd1423afa8f9dd964fda278f4fab40887512
Closes-Bug: #1361444

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-05 22:07:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_acl_scenarios.py'], 'message': 'Returns 401 when unauthorized project access occurs

Throwing wsme based exceptions out of non-wsme context causes api server
to return 500 since the exception goes uncaught. Instead return
http response with error code 401 to return to client safely

Change-Id: Ifb753581e392ea7961b976bc97ee2348feb6825c
Closes-Bug: 1365770
'}]
commit_message:
Returns 401 when unauthorized project access occurs

Throwing wsme based exceptions out of non-wsme context causes api server
to return 500 since the exception goes uncaught. Instead return
http response with error code 401 to return to client safely

Change-Id: Ifb753581e392ea7961b976bc97ee2348feb6825c
Closes-Bug: 1365770

commit_message:
Add new field micro_state to Volume table in Cinder db

As part of Cinder explicit state transition table work
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110434/ alongwith the
transition table we will need to add a new field called
'micro_state' to the Cinder DB to keep the information
of the micro state in which the volume is present
currently. The current volume "status" can be combined
of multiple micro_state's which provides a finer
granularity and will help to maintain atomicity
guarantees.

Part of blueprint cinder-state-enforcer

Part of blueprint valid-states-api

Change-Id: I92aab0698bd8f6ff6065b6db30c528de2099465f

commit_message:
Run processes without screen

This introduces new run_process() and screen_service() functions and sets the
groundwork to change how DevStack starts services.  screen_service() is simply a
direct call to the screen portion of the old screen_it() function and is intended
to run commands that only need to run under screen, such as log file watchers.

run_process() is a replacement for screen_it() (which remains until all of the
services are updated).  The usage is similar but requires updates to every current
screen_it() call to remove everything that requires the command to be interpreted
by a shell.

The old run_process() and _run_process() functions are still present as
old_run_process() and _old_run_process() to support the deprecated screen_it()
function.  These will all go away in the future once all services have been
confirmed to have been changed over.

There is a similar new set of stop process functions stop_process() and
screen_stop_service().  The old screen_stop() will also remain for the deprecation
period.

As an initial test/demostration this review also includes the changes for
lib/cinder to demonstrate what is required for every service.

I included the scripts I used to test this; tests/fake-service.sh and
tests/run-process.sh are quite rough around the edges and may bite.  They should
mature into productive members of the testing ecosystem someday.

Change-Id: I03322bf0208353ebd267811735c66f13a516637b

commit_message:
Add user namespace support for libvirt-lxc

This change adds two config values that allow deployers
to enable user namespacing for libvirt-lxc containers.
User namespacing allows the mapping of uids and gids in
a container to separate uids and gids outside of the
container. The main advantage of this is to allow a
container's processes to appear to be running as root,
while actually running as a different user on the host.

Implements: bp libvirt-lxc-user-namespaces

DocImpact: This adds two config options to the libvirt
group, uid_maps and gid_maps. Default values are empty
strings and will leave user namespacing disabled for
libvirt-lxc containers.

Change-Id: I5f517f228b477f8238eccbb604b9ffd0ebaa5927

To more cleanly support the various permutations of the following during
spawn():
- different types image to spawn with (sparse, flat, iso,
  and streamOptimized, ova in the futre)
- different ways to obtain the image (http download, and direct
  datastore copy in the future)
- different ways to prepare the downloaded image bits into a usable
  image in the image cache (replace -flat.vmdk extent, convert from
  sparse, pick from imported VM, ...)

The following are introduced:
- Image prepare/fetch/cache functions : these are callbacks for
  processing the bits into a usable form to be cached in the image cache
  under various scenarios.
- Image fetching functions : these are callbacks called by the processor
  to obtain the bits for the hypervisor.

All unit tests should pass unmodified after this refactor.

This should will allow for more self-contained additions/changes
to behaviors in these areas in the future.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I8fb46b5a3ef4bb89a6084df955d82821216ebb40

commit_message:
VMware: spawn refactor image fetch/cache

To more cleanly support the various permutations of the following during
spawn():
- different types image to spawn with (sparse, flat, iso,
  and streamOptimized, ova in the futre)
- different ways to obtain the image (http download, and direct
  datastore copy in the future)
- different ways to prepare the downloaded image bits into a usable
  image in the image cache (replace -flat.vmdk extent, convert from
  sparse, pick from imported VM, ...)

The following are introduced:
- Image prepare/fetch/cache functions : these are callbacks for
  processing the bits into a usable form to be cached in the image cache
  under various scenarios.
- Image fetching functions : these are callbacks called by the processor
  to obtain the bits for the hypervisor.

All unit tests should pass unmodified after this refactor.

This should will allow for more self-contained additions/changes
to behaviors in these areas in the future.

Co-authored-by: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>
partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor
Change-Id: I8fb46b5a3ef4bb89a6084df955d82821216ebb40

commit_message:
Initial congressclient

This patch adds client support for congress with keystone and supports
the following api commands:

	$ openstack congress policy list
	$ openstack congress policy row get
	$ openstack congress policy rule create
	$ openstack congress policy rule delete
	$ openstack congress policy rules list

Change-Id: I624b54f6cf2614eaec970c8bdd3766291dcc9489

commit_message:
Fix security group list when not defined for an instance

If an instance has an empty security group list an exception
is thrown due to iteration attempt of None.

To fix this, this patch modifies get_instance_security_group
to return an empty list instead of None.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_neutron_security_groups.py
	nova/tests/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py

Change-Id: I7efb3c3a58d7e20501d126c6d194479ca1d14166
Closes-Bug: #1291489
(cherry picked from commit c32986966dfd034c3d706b2e9ab2820a2c3cfc3e)

commit_message:
Make osprofiler library optional for services

This makes it possible to run Cinder w/o osprofiler
installed.  Note that you may need to remove it from
your api-paste configuration as well.

It remains in requirements.txt since the default
api-paste configuration does use it.

Closes-Bug: #1361239

Change-Id: I46199f6e951c02a80e9cc763de364dbbd800b10d

commit_message:
Log ERROR power state in node_power_action()

Power driver can returns ERROR state. Log this error and do not
break requested action (this can be unknown valid state).

Partial-Bug: #1358816
Change-Id: I9b26440671cb44b58016dfd796adbd8fedd483ae

subject: Translator functions cleanup part 3
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-09 12:15:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/dhcp/neutron.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py', 'ironic/objects/base.py'], 'message': 'Translator functions cleanup part 3

This part fixes ironic/conductor, ironic/dhcp and ironic/objects
folders.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: Ib4b93cc49f16836a95c7cfb4c5f1705f5cbbb31f
'}]
commit_message:
Translator functions cleanup part 3

This part fixes ironic/conductor, ironic/dhcp and ironic/objects
folders.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: Ib4b93cc49f16836a95c7cfb4c5f1705f5cbbb31f

commit_message:
Make assertion in assert_ostf_run_certain more verbose

Right now if assert_ostf_run_certain fails, the output is
"AssertionError: Condition was False."
which does not help much. The change makes it more verbose
giving the details of tests which must have passed but failed.

Change-Id: Iab373c3d4809e6f27147f9331f80ba03f02ae801

commit_message:
Install the correct arping package for neutron

Debian requires the iputils-arping package (not arping)
for the neutron L3 agent.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2b127a247852fd5c6b9b2d270ba13f012386fe31
Closes-Bug: #1352558

subject: Change default congress port to non reserved port number 1789
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-10 19:23:02.000000000', 'files': ['congress/common/config.py', 'doc/source/tutorial-tenant-sharing.rst', 'congress/tests/test_config.py', 'doc/source/troubleshooting.rst', 'contrib/devstack/lib/congress'], 'message': 'Change default congress port to non reserved port number 1789

This patch changes the default port number congress-server uses from 8080
to 1789 which is not reserved by anyone yet. 1789 is also the date that
the United States Congress was created so this number seems like a good
fit.

Change-Id: Ie3cf2639408cf3aa8d2cb64532871835f1cdf0d1
Closes-bug: 1364126
'}]
commit_message:
Change default congress port to non reserved port number 1789

This patch changes the default port number congress-server uses from 8080
to 1789 which is not reserved by anyone yet. 1789 is also the date that
the United States Congress was created so this number seems like a good
fit.

Change-Id: Ie3cf2639408cf3aa8d2cb64532871835f1cdf0d1
Closes-bug: 1364126

commit_message:
Use mock from unittests where possible

To ensure that we work with python 3.4 (the mock library
that is not built-in to the standard library appears
currently broken there) we should try to use the mock
that is built-in to python 3.3+ when possible to ensure
maximum compatibility.

Change-Id: Ifc2fcb9f52ffc24166857492579a84539bcdf071

subject: Correct api return code for invalid urls
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-05 21:57:43.000000000', 'files': ['congress/api/webservice.py', 'congress/api/application.py', 'congress/tests/api/test_application.py'], 'message': 'Correct api return code for invalid urls

This patch changes the server response from 501 to 404 when a request
is made to a url that is unknown. This behavior makes the behavior in
congress also consistent with how the other openstack apis function.

Change-Id: I537aa3a9b8229fbeea5fba4dcb1a8c7e905bf7d3
Closes-bug: 1366177
'}]
commit_message:
Correct api return code for invalid urls

This patch changes the server response from 501 to 404 when a request
is made to a url that is unknown. This behavior makes the behavior in
congress also consistent with how the other openstack apis function.

Change-Id: I537aa3a9b8229fbeea5fba4dcb1a8c7e905bf7d3
Closes-bug: 1366177

subject: Remove unneed step to set fixed-ip and neutron cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-10 17:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/tutorial-tenant-sharing.rst'], 'message': 'Remove unneed step to set fixed-ip and neutron cleanup

This patch removes an uneeded step to set a fixed ip on a port. This is
unneeded because neutron automatically allocates you a fixed-ip when
the port is created. In addition, this hides the provider information which is
only shown if one configures neutron to use vxlan/vlan for the transport type.

Change-Id: Id08d456cac0dcbf9b8517779ebaccfd5d9025bef
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unneed step to set fixed-ip and neutron cleanup

This patch removes an uneeded step to set a fixed ip on a port. This is
unneeded because neutron automatically allocates you a fixed-ip when
the port is created. In addition, this hides the provider information which is
only shown if one configures neutron to use vxlan/vlan for the transport type.

Change-Id: Id08d456cac0dcbf9b8517779ebaccfd5d9025bef

commit_message:
Move to oslo.db

Replace common oslo code nova.openstack.common.db by usage
of oslo.db library and remove common code.

Replaced catching of raw sqlalchemy exceptions by catches
of oslo.db exceptions(such as DBError, DBDuplicateEntry, etc).

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 8874, 'name': 'ling-yun', 'email': 'YunlingZeng@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ling-yun'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9366, 'name': 'Andrew Kerr', 'email': 'andrew.kerr@netapp.com', 'username': 'andrew-kerr'}, {'_account_id': 11811, 'name': 'HP Storage CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.ci@external.groups.hp.com', 'username': 'hp-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12604, 'name': 'Adelina Tuvenie', 'email': 'atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'atuvenie'}, {'_account_id': 12778, 'name': 'HDS HNAS CI', 'email': 'OpenStackDevelopment@hds.com', 'username': 'hds-hnas-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13049, 'name': 'Coraid CI', 'email': 'coraid-openstack-ci-all@mirantis.com', 'username': 'coraid-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-04 13:11:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/windows/windows.py', 'cinder/tests/windows/test_windows.py'], 'message': "Fixes Cinder fails to upload volume to vhd image

The method copy_volume_to_image from windows.py specifies the
wrong volume format, namely 'vpc'. In this case, the upload_volume
method from image_utils will attempt to convert the volume to vhd
which will result in an error from qemu as it does not recognize
the format.

This patch fixes this issue by using 'vhd' as a format when
uploading volumes

Change-Id: Ifa675316e19f9a795e103fd56fcdf4e3ed00aab7
Closes-Bug: #1365487
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes Cinder fails to upload volume to vhd image

The method copy_volume_to_image from windows.py specifies the
wrong volume format, namely 'vpc'. In this case, the upload_volume
method from image_utils will attempt to convert the volume to vhd
which will result in an error from qemu as it does not recognize
the format.

This patch fixes this issue by using 'vhd' as a format when
uploading volumes

Change-Id: Ifa675316e19f9a795e103fd56fcdf4e3ed00aab7
Closes-Bug: #1365487

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-15 19:17:18.000000000', 'files': ['elements/haproxy/os-apply-config/etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg'], 'message': "Adding HTTP mode to HAProxy stats

HAProxy's stats interface was not launching due to the default mode
for HAProxy having been set to TCP.  This patch remedies this by
directlys setting the http mode on the listener.

Change-Id: I367473049a52bf3ca0b2ac482ddb96ee39d6e045
Closes-Bug: #1355763
"}]
commit_message:
Adding HTTP mode to HAProxy stats

HAProxy's stats interface was not launching due to the default mode
for HAProxy having been set to TCP.  This patch remedies this by
directlys setting the http mode on the listener.

Change-Id: I367473049a52bf3ca0b2ac482ddb96ee39d6e045
Closes-Bug: #1355763

subject: Support py34 tox target.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-09 18:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py'], 'message': 'Support py34 tox target.

OpenStack is making a push to move projects that had been tested on py33
to py34 because py34 will have a much larger install base (and is
consequently easier to test).

The python 3.4 json lib returns new and different error strings when
json decoding fails. Remove assertions from test_load_list_from_json
hat check these error strings, instead simply rely on assertRaises to
assert that the appropriate error is thrown.

Change-Id: Ia6603783014b0114de0f29664834d21196744774
'}]
commit_message:
Support py34 tox target.

OpenStack is making a push to move projects that had been tested on py33
to py34 because py34 will have a much larger install base (and is
consequently easier to test).

The python 3.4 json lib returns new and different error strings when
json decoding fails. Remove assertions from test_load_list_from_json
hat check these error strings, instead simply rely on assertRaises to
assert that the appropriate error is thrown.

Change-Id: Ia6603783014b0114de0f29664834d21196744774

commit_message:
Deprecate Ironic compute driver and sched manager

Updates the Ironic compute driver and scheduler manager so that they
subclass the now in-Nova-tree driver classes. This should de-duplicate
code maintenance across Nova and Ironic and also provide end users
an easier upgrade path (with Deprecation log messages).

This patch also removes the old Ironic compute driver tests and classes
since those now live in Nova.

This patch also removes a line from tox.ini which was copying the second
set of unit test outputs; those no longer exist, since we are no longer
running unit tests on nova code in this tree.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic194f779eca470e4a4dd8a3fbd31ca5a6f6b4f7e

commit_message:
Fix column headings regression due to switch to cliutils

After switch to cliutils in https://review.openstack.org/72418
field_labels argument is no longer respected in print_list.
This patch updates cliutils to version introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113978 and fixes usage
of the newly-introduced field_labels argument to print_list.

Change-Id: I4c5ca149816e4476f170b30de6855dec747522dd
Closes-Bug: #1342391

commit_message:
Add value for 'sed -i' parameter

Some versions of sed (MacOS and maybe BSD) show error if value for '-i'
parameter is missed. Without this change we can not run
'make version-yaml' on these OSes.

Change-Id: Ib81befbe302c9cb25c4bf67e45ae5dd90d58009a

commit_message:
Add PrePatching hook for HA envs

Add PrePatching and PostPathing hook for HA envs
that migrates pacemaker services
from the controllers being patched, process and
unbans particular nodes for OpenStack pacemaker
services.

Also:
- add post node deploy hook;
- rename PostDeploy to PostDeployment hook;
- refactroning hooks;
- add tests.

Change-Id: If1f3bba164c88710d2ae111ae813be0ae0f97803
Partial-bug: #1364068
Closes-bug: #1365635
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Sharshov <vsharshov@mirantis.com>

For given (hook hardcode) services,
* 1st try to stop specified services
  gracefully with stop action
* 2nd, if there are some services' related processes
  are still running, send SIGKILL for all their childs as well.
* Add unit test with hardcode services list
