2. StopOSTServices
3. PrePatching

All of this now PreNode hooks.

Related-bug: #1364068

Change-Id: Ida1eb0fbedbd93c2898142205a09c6ee351eeac4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add stop all OST services pre-deploy hook

For given (hook hardcode) services,
* 1st try to stop specified services
  gracefully with stop action
* 2nd, if there are some services' related processes
  are still running, send SIGKILL for all their childs as well.
* Add unit test with hardcode services list

Also change order of pre hooks:
1. PrePatchingHa
2. StopOSTServices
3. PrePatching

All of this now PreNode hooks.

Related-bug: #1364068

Change-Id: Ida1eb0fbedbd93c2898142205a09c6ee351eeac4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Optionally use public DNS for unittest and build.

This commit adds an option to worker, use_public_dns,
so the containers used during unittest and build use 8.8.8.8
and 8.8.4.4 instead of their host's resolv.conf settings.

Change-Id: I8d272509d685eadce2cc2783699ca893b9901202

subject: utilize drone cli to run unit tests when installed
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-09 20:37:45.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/solum', 'contrib/lp-cedarish/docker/unittest-app'], 'message': "utilize drone cli to run unit tests when installed

if drone is installed we will use drone cli to run tests rather
than building our own dockerfile etc.   If .drone.yml exists
in the user's repo then we will use that natively, if not then
we will construct one via details in the planfile.

if drone is not installed, then we'll do the testing the old

Created a new local.conf variable 'SOLUM_INSTALL_DRONE' which

Change-Id: I528929df53561e9977d1b672e4b4ed0de4a89951

commit_message:
utilize drone cli to run unit tests when installed

if drone is installed we will use drone cli to run tests rather
than building our own dockerfile etc.   If .drone.yml exists
in the user's repo then we will use that natively, if not then
we will construct one via details in the planfile.

if drone is not installed, then we'll do the testing the old
fashioned way.

Created a new local.conf variable 'SOLUM_INSTALL_DRONE' which
will install drone during stack creation if set.

Change-Id: I528929df53561e9977d1b672e4b4ed0de4a89951

subject: Fix update of backend details in cmode driver
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-09-09 10:41:56.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/netapp/cluster_mode.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/test_cluster_mode.py'], 'message': "Fix update of backend details in cmode driver

There are dependency on backend details, that are stored in database,
in cmode driver. And if share server could not be created for some reason,
backend details won't be present in database. This fix updates database
at start of server creation, before sending request for creation.
There are still present possibility to get empty details, but it is
not related to driver itself, it is related to gap between creation of server
in database and call of driver's method for server creation. That could be,
for example, in case when share-network provided with wrong network data.

also added unittests to changed method due to absense of it.

Change-Id: Id1f8a4607b0dd09eb79b56b600088e8a70fbd47a
Closes-Bug: #1357273
"}]
commit_message:
Fix update of backend details in cmode driver

There are dependency on backend details, that are stored in database,
in cmode driver. And if share server could not be created for some reason,
backend details won't be present in database. This fix updates database
at start of server creation, before sending request for creation.
There are still present possibility to get empty details, but it is
not related to driver itself, it is related to gap between creation of server
in database and call of driver's method for server creation. That could be,
for example, in case when share-network provided with wrong network data.

also added unittests to changed method due to absense of it.

Change-Id: Id1f8a4607b0dd09eb79b56b600088e8a70fbd47a
Closes-Bug: #1357273

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-09 18:53:03.000000000', 'files': ['solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/plan.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'solum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_trigger.py', 'solum/api/handlers/assembly_handler.py', 'solum/tests/api/handlers/test_assembly.py', 'solum/worker/config.py', 'etc/solum/solum.conf.sample', 'requirements.txt', 'solum/worker/handlers/shell.py', 'solum/tests/worker/handlers/test_shell.py', 'solum/tests/worker/handlers/test_shell_nobuild.py', 'solum/api/controllers/v1/trigger.py', 'solum/worker/handlers/shell_nobuild.py'], 'message': 'Send back testing results

As a CI tool Solum should be able to report testing
results back to user. This patch handles the case of
hosting code on Github. By leveraging Github API,
Solum can send back the statuses of testing, i.e.
pending/success/failure and a log url for user to
inspect results.

A Github OAuth token is used for posting statuses.
The token will need to be generated by a user and
put into Solum plan file.

Closes-bug: 1365651

Change-Id: I223418f63d663a9673963b1f6a7a4367bd1766e1
'}]
commit_message:
Send back testing results

As a CI tool Solum should be able to report testing
results back to user. This patch handles the case of
hosting code on Github. By leveraging Github API,
Solum can send back the statuses of testing, i.e.
pending/success/failure and a log url for user to
inspect results.

A Github OAuth token is used for posting statuses.
The token will need to be generated by a user and
put into Solum plan file.

Closes-bug: 1365651

Change-Id: I223418f63d663a9673963b1f6a7a4367bd1766e1

commit_message:
Don't allow security service to be updated if used

When we attach security service to share network and create
share server associated with this share network, security service
or share-network should not be updated as well as deleted.

For update should be available only 'name' and 'description' fields.

Don't allow to remove assigned security-service from share-network
when share-servers exist.

Add unit and tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ide82edea355030b281dc709f8545abfd0fcd13fb
Closes-bug: #1357355

subject: Add GlusterFS protocol as a supported Share/NAS type
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-09 10:41:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': "Add GlusterFS protocol as a supported Share/NAS type

This patch adds GlusterFS as a supported protocol (in addition
to NFS and CIFS) in the Share/NAS type doc/help string. Since the
Manila server side now support cert based access type which
introduced 'glusterfs' as a new share protocol, this patch
updates the manilaclient help/doc string to reflect the same.

'glusterfs' protocol support was added to server side using:
https://review.openstack.org/116859

Change-Id: I94cbecd55fabbfd1bb7c06184e4679c7531d0214
Closes-Bug: #1367205
"}]
commit_message:
Add GlusterFS protocol as a supported Share/NAS type

This patch adds GlusterFS as a supported protocol (in addition
to NFS and CIFS) in the Share/NAS type doc/help string. Since the
Manila server side now support cert based access type which
introduced 'glusterfs' as a new share protocol, this patch
updates the manilaclient help/doc string to reflect the same.

'glusterfs' protocol support was added to server side using:
https://review.openstack.org/116859

Change-Id: I94cbecd55fabbfd1bb7c06184e4679c7531d0214
Closes-Bug: #1367205

'message': 'Avoid URL-encoding of values

Mustache will URL-encode values containing certain characters if a
double brace is used. EG "Secr<tP'ss" encodes as "Secr<tP'ss".
This is probably undesirable in all config files.

The Ex command used to apply this:

    :silent! %s/{\@<!{{\([^{#^\/].\{-}\)}}/{{{\1}}}/g

The Vim macro used to fix merge conflicts, as I expect I'll have to use
this more than once before this merges:

    /<<<<<<^MV/======^M:s/{\@<!{{[#/^{]\@!/{{{/g^M
    :'<,'>s/\({{{[^}]*}}\)}\@!/\1}/g^M
    ?<<<<<<^Mdd/======^MV/>>>>>>^Md

Change-Id: I667cda250aaf4e9d9cb76d971665d22cbd7681a5
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid URL-encoding of values

Mustache will URL-encode values containing certain characters if a
double brace is used. EG "Secr<tP'ss" encodes as "Secr<tP'ss".
This is probably undesirable in all config files.

The Ex command used to apply this:

    :silent! %s/{\@<!{{\([^{#^\/].\{-}\)}}/{{{\1}}}/g

The Vim macro used to fix merge conflicts, as I expect I'll have to use
this more than once before this merges:

    /<<<<<<^MV/======^M:s/{\@<!{{[#/^{]\@!/{{{/g^M
    :'<,'>s/\({{{[^}]*}}\)}\@!/\1}/g^M
    ?<<<<<<^Mdd/======^MV/>>>>>>^Md

Change-Id: I667cda250aaf4e9d9cb76d971665d22cbd7681a5

commit_message:
Propose a more generic volume migration approach

This will allow the RBD driver and others that don't support iSCSI
attachment to support volume migration.

Related blueprint: generic-volume-migration

Change-Id: I33b1019ed6c690bd5fe9a01365c7666cc0413af2

Ceilometer will consider the 'Sensor Reading' data contains the unit in
the end of current value, ipmitool driver returns such format, however our
ipminative driver returns the 'Sensor Reading' value without the unit, so we

commit_message:
Unify the sensor data format

Ceilometer will consider the 'Sensor Reading' data contains the unit in
the end of current value, ipmitool driver returns such format, however our
ipminative driver returns the 'Sensor Reading' value without the unit, so we
have to unify them for Ceilometer to provide same sensor data format.

Closes-Bug: #1367620

Change-Id: I6796bf513730259b7a27715252a72879b11d3bae

commit_message:
Fix syntax errors in JSON doc samples

Some doc samples weren't valid JSON files. This commit fixes syntax
errors in those files and adds a unit test that will validate JSON files.

Change-Id: Ibaf1423303e2d278cc213d180801d597164601a3

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune

commit_message:
Switch to using pbr's autodoc capability

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I777bdeaee5332a73ee39bc5bdc832bd0140724ce
